Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative:
on XX/XX/XXXX Me and Navy Federal Credit Union discussed a settlement and agreed at {$8600.00} for a {$13000.00} balance on the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that has been closed since XXXX and procured interest at +18.00 % of the unpaid balance. I paid {$1000.00} that day in addition to previous payments towards a stubborn balance. 


The statements says it will take 27 years to pay off. 


So, on XXXX I authorized the settlement payments over the phone. 

I was under the impression that the payments would be withdrawn where as we discussed withdrawals from my savings account. 
*** The representative never stated that the remaining payments Needed to be made by phone every time or that I would have to set it up manually after our call for the agreement to hold. *** However, their calls are recorded and I asked the supervisor did the representative relay the information that I would need to set up the additional payments manually where as they were only authorizing a payment for that day and not any further, she said she did not hear him disclose the information or provide those necessary details. 

That disclosure/information would have been vital for success of the settlement. 

Where as the authorization I gave over the phone was my understanding of a reoccurring withdrawal authorization because we discussed a date and from which account the payments would be withdrawn. 



Solutions : I asked her if we get a new agreement and possibly at a lesser amount than before or the remaining balance ( around {$7400.00} ) and she said they were not legally required to share that information or clarify that future payments would require action by phone. 

I contacted you guys because I believe the authorization of my payments over the phone was to be automatically withdrawn. 
___ I asked Navy Federal for a review of my interest rate because of the SCRA act stating no more than 6 % of interest for XXXX XXXX, Reservists, and other members of the armed forces. They sent me a form to fill out for my proof of service. 
I have paid on this credit card through financial struggle and Navy Federal has withdrawn money from my accounts without authorization because they said " It is their right to '' they have applied + $ 18.00 % in addition to my minimum payment consistently regardless of the payments I've made. 

Before I proceed with any further payments or agreements I would like you guys to help me. I am a new mom, I just had my son in XXXX, and before COVID-19, I was a stellar member with my finances in order. 

I even asked could we tally up payments made to the account to come to a solution of settlement because I want to be a homeowner and have a greater credit score, but they are hindering me with the negative reports, excessive interest, and misleading agreements.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

4. 15 USC 1681 Section 602 states I have a right to privacy.

5. **15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ) Section 2 states a credit reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

6. 15 USC 1666 ( b ) a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to Despite my previous attempts to resolve this issue with both the creditor and your agency, the inaccuracies remain on my report. If you can not verify the debt, please remove this off my account for the THIRD TIME!!!

According to FRCA section 605 ( c ) you are in error by even updating this account! I am disputing all inaccuracies including my address.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX, I initiated a transfer of money to my Laurel Road checking account, and I noticed that the day after I did that, they wouldn't let me log into my account because they claimed that they have to do a security check. I want to close my account with Laurel Road and get my money back because I have seen many negative reviews about this company and how they mistreat their customers, and I feel the same way. I sent in my phone bill statement, and the bank account statement from which I transferred money to my Laurel Road checking account per their request. This is the message I got after I tried to log in on their website " We're conducting a security review to protect your account. We may reach out to you for additional information, if needed. Most reviews are resolved within 10 business days. For help, call XXXX or TDD/TTY : XXXX. ". I have never experienced any bank or company doing something like this before, and I am astonished that they're able to get away with this.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a dispute with Credit Collection Services for violation of FDCPA and they did not respond to my dispute nor provided me with any information on my rights to dispute before adding these collections to my consumers report. 

( a ) Notice of debt ; contents Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 1 ) the amount of the debt ; ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor.

( b ) Disputed debts If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. Collection activities and communications that do not otherwise violate this subchapter may continue during the 30-day period referred to in subsection ( a ) unless the consumer has notified the debt collector in writing that the debt, or any portion of the debt, is disputed or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor. Any collection activities and communication during the 30-day period XXXX not overshadow or be inconsistent with the disclosure of the consumers right to dispute the debt or request the name and address of the original creditor. 

( c ) Admission of liability The failure of a consumer to dispute the validity of a debt under this section may not be construed by any court as an admission of liability by the consumer.

( d ) Legal pleadings A communication in the form of a formal pleading in a civil action shall not be treated as an initial communication for purposes of subsection ( a ).

( e ) Notice provisions The sending or delivery of any form or notice which does not relate to the collection of a debt and is expressly required by title 26, title V of Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act [ 15 U.S.C. 6801 et seq. ], or any provision of Federal or State law relating to notice of data security breach or privacy, or any regulation prescribed under any such provision of law, shall not be treated as an initial communication in connection with debt collection for purposes of this section.

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Application denials
Consumer complaint narrative:
I On XX/XX/2024 I received a clear to close. By XXXX and cardinal financial. Later that day documents were prepared. I went to attorneys office and signed all documents including promissory note and given keys to the new home. As I sat there while attorney prepared to wire funds. The attorney told me the lender refuse to authorize release of funds. I called the lender at the closing table to find out what was going on. XXXX XXXX Of XXXX told me the loan was in quality control. 
He said I needed a letter of what my intentions with the home were. Also I needed a note that I can work remote or a job letter. Both of which I provided being the intentions and the job letter. Then he asked me about signature on gift letter which they already received and verify XXXX weeks prior to giving clear to close. Then they started asking about the name on my email. Then they asked me about money I sent to my son via XXXX if it was child support payment. Then after providing a job letter which they verify. They then ask me to provide a direct deposit verification from the employer. If the employer didnt provide direct deposit they the lender would find another solution. 
When I informed them that the employer does provide direct deposit. XXXX then proceeded to tell me. That the FHA deny the loan because you dont have a job in Georgia XXXX When the listing agent called to ask what was the sellers option because the transaction closed. The lender told the listing agent that they could fund the sale. So the seller can get there money. Then they would foreclose on the home. At this point everyone associated with this transaction was bewildered. Ive met all the requirements they asked of me. Up until signing the promissory note everything was good. 
I followed all the instructions they gave me and they led me down the dark road and now Im homeless. Now Im sleep on someone couch for the past week and a half. This experience has been a nightmare for me. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX cardinal financial. XXXX XXXX of cardinal financial they all made me feel criminalized. Also I requested the denial letter on the denial day and havent received it yet. Ive followed up and still nothing.

I trust that you will handle this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. Please confirm the removal of these transactions from my report as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Transunion for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ).

Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$9900.00} I previously submitted a dispute to Transunion regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Transunion failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report.

As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Transunion failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Transunion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Transunion upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a victim of identity theft. The person who stole my identity was also able to obtain a copy of my credit report. With this information, they are able to call Experian and unlock, unfreeze, and remove my fraud alerts from my credit reports. This has resulted in several applications being made against my credit. They were also able to call in and change my account email, password, and phone number, and remove my XXXX security. This is all despite the fact that I have a secret question and pin number associated with the account. 

I spoke with several customer service specialists and their managers and they all told me that if someone can answer the questions derived from the credit report they can bypass the security question and the pin number. 

This is effectively telling me that there is no possible way for me to secure my credit report through Experian. XXXX and XXXX were able to add secondary measures to prevent this sort of thing from happening, but Experian did not. 

I asked for this to be escalated but have not received any response. I would like to get this resolved as the person is actively and daily attempting to gain control over my Experian account and unlock my credit report. 

I pay for the premium membership at Experian as well. The additional security features added by having a premiere account still do not help the scenario where someone can call in and answer 4 questions from the credit report. 

This was not done by accessing my account online as I have changed my username and password several times, I also have always had XXXX enabled on the account. 

Experian does not adequately protect accounts in situations where an identity thief has not only a person 's SSN but also their credit report. 

I've filed a police report and supplied it to Experian with no response.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I am writing in regards to an alleged debt with Midland Credit Management Acct XXXX XXXX that your company has on my credit profile. I am requesting Assignment Contract of the debt details. The Fair Debt Collection Practice Act requires debt collectors to validate the debt upon request. Can you provide the name of the original creditor as well as the account number associated with the debt. Proof that I am the person who owes this said debt along with the original amount of said debt, I would also like and itemized statement showing how the current balance was calculated. Documentation stating that your company has legal authority to collect on this debt. I XXXX XXXX am not ADMITTING OWNERSHIP OF THIS SAID DEBT until debt is proven valid. Per The FDCPA you must seize all the collection efforts until your company has proven proper validation of Debt. I am disputing the validity of this said debt please provide the requested documentation in writing and you have 30 days to do so. At any state you fail to comply with validating the debt it will be taken as absolute refusal to do so. This is also being reported as income to the IRS per a 1099C Be advised that if it is found your offices have made a report with false information to XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX XXXX this may constitute fraud in both Federal and State law. If you are working on behalf of the creditor, you will also need to provide Details of your company and license of authority The date of your license agreement The name on the license License Number Registered address and telephone number of the license provider XXXX XXXX

Recently i did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall -- i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Formal Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of FCRA Section 623 Due to Reinsertion of Previously Deleted Account XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion for violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 623, by reinserting an account that was previously deleted from my credit report due to inaccuracy and discrepancy, THIS IS A VIOLATIONG TO THE LAWS Violation of 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), Violation of 607 ( b ) AND Violation of 611 ( d ).

Account Number : [ XXXX XXXX ] Report Date : [ XX/XX/year> ] I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion LLC regarding the reinsertion of an account that was previously removed from my credit report due to inaccuracy in THE DATE ( XX/XX/year> ) AFTER THEY HAD RECEIVED ( ATTACH : THIS IS THE LETTER SENT TO THE XXXX DISPUTING THE INACCURACIES ) XX/XX/year> REGARDING THE VIOLATION AND INACCURACIES THAT THE ACCOUNT HAD ON XX/XX/year>, TRANSUNION SENT ME THE NOTIFICATION OF THE DELETION OF THE ACCOUNT ( XXXX  XXXX ) TO WHICH I AM ADDING PROOF THAT IT WAS SUCCESSFULLY REMOVED, BASED ON THE INACCURACIES AND DISCREPANCY THAT IT HAD BEFORE THE 30 DAYS OF THE INVESTIGATION HAD COMPLETED. 

Background On [ Date XX/XX/year> ], I disputed an account listed on my credit report with TransUnion because the information was inaccurate. After a thorough investigation, TransUnion removed the account from my credit report in the ( date XX/XX/year> ), acknowledging the inaccuracy. 

However, on [ XX/XX/year> ], ( attach proof the reinsertion account ) I discovered that TransUnion had reinserted the previously deleted account into my credit report without proper notification or verification of the accuracy of the information. This action directly violates my rights under the FCRA.

This reinsertion has been done in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The specific sections of the FCRA that have been violated are as follows : Violation of Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) - Reinsertion of Disputed Information : According to this section of the FCRA, if an item is deleted due to inaccuracy, it can not be reinserted into the credit report unless the information provider certifies that the information is complete and accurate. TransUnion did not provide me with any such certification or notification within the five business days required by law. Furthermore, the consumer must be notified in writing within five business days if the information is reinserted. 

In this case, the account identified as [ XXXX XXXX ] was previously removed from my credit report after I disputed its accuracy. However, TransUnion has reinserted this account without providing me with any verification of its accuracy or completeness, nor did I receive any notification from TransUnion within the required five-day period. 

2.Violation of Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Duty to Correct and Update Information : Under this section, the furnisher of the information has a duty to correct and update the information that is found to be inaccurate. The reinsertion of the previously removed account, without correcting the inaccuracy that led to its removal, constitutes a clear violation of this duty.

3.Violation of Section 611 ( d ) - Notification of Reinsertion : This section mandates that when a previously deleted item is reinserted, the credit bureau must notify the consumer in writing and provide a summary of their rights under the FCRA. TransUnion failed to provide any such notification, leaving me unaware of the reinsertion until I checked my report. REMOVE INMEDIATLY THE ACCOUNT FOR VIOLATION TO MY RIGHT.

TransUnion has failed to provide me with the required written notice and summary of my rights after reinserting the account. This failure constitutes a direct violation of my rights under the FCRA.

4. Violation of 607 ( b ) Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA requires credit bureaus to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. By reinserting an account that was previously removed due to inaccuracy, TransUnion has demonstrated a failure to adhere to these procedures, resulting in a report that does not reflect accurate or reliable information.

Harm Caused The unauthorized reinsertion of this inaccurate account has caused significant harm, including potential damage to my credit score, increased stress, and the need to spend additional time and resources to correct the error. This has affected my ability to obtain credit on favorable terms and caused undue distress. Am very sad because is in the process to buy my home for my childs. please help that imposible than ONLY TRANSUNION REINSERT THIS ACCOUNT XXXX AND XXXX WAS DELETE DEFINITELY FOR INNACURATE THE PROOF IS ATTACH IN THIS COMPLAINT. AND THE PICTURES IS VERY CLEAR.

Consumer complaint narrative:
After a recent review of my credit report, I discovered that Experian is reporting inaccurate information. The inaccuracies include : Monthly Payment Date Opened Balance No. of Months ( terms ) High Credit Credit Limit Past Due Payment Status Last Reported Comments Date Last Active Date of Last Payment Two-Year Payment History These inaccuracies are not only misleading but also falsely manipulate the statute of limitations. Despite my repeated requests for investigation, Experian has failed to address these discrepancies correctly, thus violating my rights. Both results returned as verified including the most recent results from XX/XX/year> ( Attached ). This inaccurate information falsely manipulates the statute of limitations. You failed to investigate this account properly after I asked you to do it TWICE and your neglect has violated my rights.

I am demanding the deletion of the inaccurate account. 

Accounts Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX DELETE this inaccurate account!!!

Specific Violations : I requested that you provide me with the name and address of the person ( s ) that you contacted to allegedly verify the information that I have rightfully disputed. But you FAILED to do so. Violating The Fair Credit Reporting Act, Public law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsection A-D FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : Experian is reporting fraudulent accounts that do not belong to me, infringing on my privacy rights. I should have sole authority over what information is considered private, and my hard inquiries and account information should not be shared without my consent.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : Experians reporting falsely implies multiple inquiries and accounts were made by me, when in fact these are the results of fraudulent activities. This misleading reporting breaches the FCRA fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite previous disputes, Experian has failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information, showing willful noncompliance which could result in civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : Sharing my personal information with creditors without my consent constitutes aggravated identity theft, which carries severe penalties.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : Experian has not disclosed my right to opt out of sharing my personal information, which is deceptive and violates my consumer rights.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Experian continues to furnish inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). This practice is unacceptable.

In addition to the above, Experian has previously violated, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to agent is notice to principal notice to principal is notice to agent You [ Experian, XXXX, XXXX replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. 
On { XX/XX/XXXX } you { Experian, XXXX, XXXX } reported an alleged transaction as Late.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

I requested the information that you must have or possess by law in order for you to report a payment as late. 
This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late and the evidence that must be sent to you to prove that this transaction was late.

It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. 
Id. at XXXX ; see also XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 
15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified. 
XXXX, XXXX XXXX at XXXX. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account. 
I am requesting pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( B ) Contents ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher. 


when disputed information can not be verified is to delete that information. In particular, Section 1681i outlines consumer reporting agencies responsibilities in responding to consumers disputes and, like Section 1681s-2 ( b ), provides that when a disputed item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency must delete or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). Section 1681i goes on to provide that, [ f ] ollowing any deletion of information which is found to be inaccurate or whose accuracy can no longer be verified, the consumer reporting agency must in some circumstances notify certain people who previously received a report with the now-deleted information. That provision thus contemplates that when information can no longer be verified, the proper response is to delet [ e ] it. Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy of certain negative information on my credit report. Specifically, two accounts that were included in my bankruptcy are showing incorrect dates and are inaccurately reported as adverse. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e, credit reporting agencies are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information they report.

Details of the Disputed Accounts : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Bankruptcy Inclusion : DIMISSED Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Bankruptcy Inclusion : DISMIISED Description of Dispute : The accounts listed above were included in my bankruptcy, and according to the FCRA guidelines, they should not be reporting as adverse. Furthermore, the dates reported are inaccurate and do not reflect the correct information. This discrepancy violates the requirement for accuracy under 15 U.S.C. 1681e.

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the following accounts, which have been inaccurately reported on my credit reports by XXXX, XXXX, and Experian. These accounts are not mine, and their presence on my credit report constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX I would like to bring to your attention that these unauthorized accounts have violated my rights under the FCRA as follows : Right to Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ) : According to this section, I have the right to privacy regarding my personal credit information. The reporting of these unauthorized accounts on my credit report breaches this right, as I did not consent to their inclusion. Furnishing of Accounts Without My Written Instructions ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : The FCRA clearly states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. I have never provided any authorization or instruction for these accounts to be reported under my name. These violations have caused significant distress and potential harm to my financial standing. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure that the unauthorized accounts are removed from my credit reports. Additionally, I request that any necessary corrective action be taken against the responsible parties to prevent future violations of my rights. Enclosed with this letter are copies of my credit reports from XXXX, XXXX, and Experian, highlighting the unauthorized accounts. I have also included any relevant correspondence that may assist in the investigation. Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I trust that the CFPB will take swift action to resolve this issue and uphold the protections guaranteed to me under the FCRA. Please feel free to contact me if you require any additional information or documentation. Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had an auto loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that was paid off in full in XXXX of 2023 A late fee that was supposed to be reversed was erroneously carried over into the balance after payment in full. 

A second late fee was then applied due to this mistake on XXXX XXXX XXXX behalf. 

After I discussed this issue with XXXX XXXX XXXX, both fees were successfully reversed by XXXX  ( as documented above in my statement ) and the loan was considered to be closed without additional payment on my behalf. 

I had called XXXX XXXX XXXX and discussed this adverse report. Since the account is already paid in full and close, they had explicitly told me to file a dispute with the credit bureaus as this was erroneously reported as an adverse event. I had asked them to make a notation in my account regarding this discussion. 

To clarify, this adverse credit report was due to an error made by XXXX XXXX XXXX. There were no additional payments required or made by me after my final XX/XX/year> payment. 

I had filed a dispute with Experian regarding this adverse credit report, but they had resolved the case as " Remains '' despite not asking for additional information. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX XXXX, and this is my response to CREDENCE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT regarding their collection practices related to an alleged debt, which I believe are in violation of several consumer protection laws, specifically 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ), and 15 USC 1681s-2 ( 7 ) ( A ). 

According to my credit report, there is a XXXX XXXX account listed that was opened on XX/XX/XXXX, with a debt amount of {$200.00}. I reached out to Credence Resource Management to clarify that I have been residing in XXXXXXXX XXXX, since XXXX. This situation has prompted significant doubts regarding the accuracy and legitimacy of the debt they are attempting to collect. To support my claim, I uploaded XXXX documents confirming my residence at the time the XXXX XXXX account was opened. 

Credence Resource Management has not ensured the accuracy and completeness of the information reported to the credit bureaus. They continue to report inaccurate and unverifiable information, which has negatively impacted my credit report and financial standing. 

I have provided proof of residence confirming that I was residing in XXXX when the XXXX XXXX account was established. Therefore, I request that CREDENCE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT promptly notify all credit bureaus to remove this account from my credit report as soon as possible.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was notified of this delinquent account from XXXX  on XXXX they called me about 30 times a day. The account is in my Fathers name XXXX XXXX, so does not belong to me, which they knew and stated but still said information was accurate when I disputed it with the credit card bureaus. It is also over the stature of limitation for my state North Carolina XXXX, so they are breaking 2 laws. They said they would send to the credit reporting bureaus updated information in XXXX XXXX still have seen an update or anything mailed to me from them which they said they would. Midland Credit Management is the company.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT You XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are furnishing inaccurate and incorrect information to the consumer reporting agencies. 

The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. 

You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood. 

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. 

PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return. 

The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate. 

By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate. 

15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you XXXX XXXX XXXX are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency.

You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect in accurate information immediately.

15 USC 1681 5-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information.

The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union , federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in chapter 1.

The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2024 publication.

SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you filled the account as a canceled debt.

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( il ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. 

The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I applied for residency at a new apartment in XXXX, Colorado last XX/XX/year> and the property management company ran a " hard '' credit check on me and I was docked XXXX points from my credit score for this single check by Experian which is the company my bank uses for their customer XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ). As of this week, Experian has only given me back XXXX points towards my score. I went from XXXX down to XXXX just for that single credit check. Experian gouged me for the single check and decided to ding me XXXX points?? What's up with that? That makes no sense and is completely unfair in my opinion and they are now being slow to give points back when I haven't done anything wrong to deserve being compensated back so slowly for what they took away in the single check. What possible reasoning could they possibly have to justify both the large gouging of points and now the slow replacement of the points? Is it some person at a desk making an arbitrary decision with no data supporting their actions? 

So to summarize : XXXX. They docked XXXX points for a single credit check, which is a ridiculous number to dock someone for a single check. Someone who has excellent credit. 

2. They are being extremely cheap in restoring my credit score back to its original XXXX points where I was at when they docked the big chunk of points back on XX/XX/year>. 

Is this just a broken system? and we are stuck with this ridiculous unfairness? 
What a disaster it would be if I had to make several applications to different apartment properties at the same time. Should we just never move to a new residence because they'll gut our credit every time we want to move, even though we've done nothing wrong?

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this XXXX XXXXXXXX is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on XXXX. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than XXXX  days before the payment due date. 

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered XXXX  days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. 

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, XXXX has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand. 

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being. 

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors. 

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer. 

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/year>, I submitted a XXXX XXXX XXXX  self-attestation letter, signed and certified, determining that I was a victim of XXXX, to the consumer reporting agency Experian, through their online submission.

For the purpose of this complaint, I will attach and upload a copy of the letter originally sent as a supporting document with this complaint, along with the documentation originally sent to satisfy the 605C request per Experian 's guidelines.

Originally, I provided all the required documentation pertaining to my identification, the detailed information regarding the accounts and inquiries on my credit file resulting from trafficking that should be blocked and signatures from both myself and an authorized XXXX representative. 

Today, I received a letter in the mail which was a response from Experian ( which I will also upload as a supporting document with this complaint ) stating that they could not process my request because they could not " reasonably confirm my identity with the proof provided ... '' ... I find this statement frivolous and unwarranted and would argue that it's a tactic credit reporting agencies use to " buy time '' and " procrastinate ''.

When I put in my request I sent them copies of the following documents : drivers license, social security card, birth certificate, and not one, but two utility bills with my name and current address for the past five years.

Why are they sending me a letter asking me for what I've already provided???

This is ridiculous and absurd.

How could you not verify my identity after receiving those documents?

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681, section 602 ( a ) emphasizes the importance of consumer reporting agencies acting responsibly with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for consumer privacy. XXXX, XXXX, and Experian are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is protected. This right is reinforced by 15 USC 6801, which mandates that financial institutions respect the privacy of their customers and protect the confidentiality of their nonpublic personal information. As per 15 USC 1681, section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report with the written consent of the consumer. I have not given XXXX, Experian, XXXX, or any financial institution my written consent to share my information. Therefore, any consent previously given, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. According to 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), financial institutions must inform consumers of their right to opt out of the disclosure of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties. I was not informed of this right by the information furnishers to credit agencies. Additionally, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include adverse information in a consumer report that is older than seven years, except for records of convictions of crimes. The adverse account being reported by XXXX and Experian is without my permission and is against the law. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that a person should not furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. Also, 15 USC 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain procedures to prevent violations of section 1681c and to ensure that reports are furnished only for permissible purposes. XXXX, XXXX, and Experian are failing to maintain these procedures. Lastly, under 12 CFR 1016.7, a consumer has the right to opt out at any time. I am exercising my right to opt out of the reporting services of XXXX, XXXX, and Experian.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I went to Conns located on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX TX XXXX. 
I purchase a washer for {$600.00}, with sales man XXXX XXXX. XXXX tried to get me into a credit card for {$3000.00}. I told him " I do not want to be put into a line of credit, I do not want a credit card. I want to do this purchase by the term. '' He told me that was fine, and stated " XXXX XXXX approved you for the Credit Card but we can sign you up for a loan with Conns instead ''. I asked him twice to clarify I was signing up for a loan not a credit card. He said yes. 

Today I am trying to make my first payment and find out I have a credit card with XXXX XXXX  for {$3000.00}. I don't even have a card, card number or even know my interest rate. Conns did not send me or give me any information in regards to my purchase or how to make a payment. I went to the store and informed the manager XXXX XXXX about my situation and told them they needed to fix this because I did not ask for a credit card. She stated " there is not anything we can do to fix this, plus we are going out of business ''. I was very upset with this response. They did not care and took advantage of what information I gave them. When I called another store and asked to speak with a store manager I was told from the agent over the phone. " I can let my manager know but we are all out of a job soon anyways so there is not much we can do for you, call XXXX and ask if they can help you ''. 

I need this to be fixed, I did not approve a credit card under my name for {$3000.00}. I was told I was going to be doing a 12 month loan.

Subject : Complaint Against Experian for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 
Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$9900.00} XXXX previously submitted a dispute to Experian regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Experian failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 
As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Experian failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 
I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Experian for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Experian upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Detailed payment history of my account, including the dates and times when payments were posted to my account.

Please provide this information within the timeframe prescribed by law. Failure to comply with this request may result in further action, as inaccurate reporting can have significant consequences on my creditworthiness and overall financial standing.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and resolution of this dispute. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX ]

As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) I am a victim of human debt XXXX, which falls under XXXX  according to XXXX-Debt Final rules1002, 142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within >>>>>>4 BUSINESS DAYS<<<<<<<<<pursuant to 605C of the Fair Reporting Credit Act. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX {$1500.00} -XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX {$860.00} -XXXX XXXXXXXX {$1400.00} According to the FCRA, specifically : 1. **Section 605B** : Requires the deletion of information resulting from identity theft.

2. **Section 611** : Provides the right to dispute information in my credit file.

3. **Section 623** : Requires that furnishers of information to credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information provided.

4. 15 USC 1681 Section 602 states I have a right to privacy.

5. **15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ) Section 2 states a credit reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

6. 15 USC 1666 ( b ) a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to Despite my previous attempts to resolve this issue with both the creditor and your agency, the inaccuracies remain on my report. In addition, please note that if this matter is not resolved promptly, I will be compelled to escalate my complaint to the Attorney General 's office. This step is necessary due to the multiple failed attempts to address this matter through the proper channels. I will be waiting for 30 days before I escalate this matter any further ( FRCA section 611 ( A ) ( 1 ) .According to FRCA Section 604 ( A ) ( 3 ), please provide proof of signature giving the the approval to pull my credit report, run my credit report, or do any kind of business.

If you can not verify the debt, please remove this off my account for the THIRD TIME!!!

According to FRCA section 605 ( c ) you are in error by even updating this account! I am disputing all inaccuracies including my address.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you for this time regarding the accounts listed below that continue to appear on my credit report. Despite my repeated attempts to have these inaccuracies corrected, these accounts remain on my report, negatively impacting my credit score and causing me undue stress and hardship. I am once again formally requesting that these accounts be permanently removed from my credit report. This request is made under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which obligates credit reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy of the information they report. These are the following accounts : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$0.00} - It seems that the following information reported is incorrect : account number, payment status, and date open. Get it right immediately ; otherwise, update the account from my report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX* Balance Owed : {$0.00} - You are reporting different information from other bureaus. Per FCRA, reporting must be 100 % accurate or the information must be updated. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} - Please check the Payment History and Status information on this account and adjust accordingly. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} - Please check the status of this account. It is entirely wrong, to begin with. I was never late on this account. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} - My record shows that this account was paid as Agreed and I never missed a payment. Please update it immediately.

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Delays in the application process
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TN XXXX XXXX Ph : ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX : Consumer Response XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Washington XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaint Regarding Repeated Requests for Documentation in Loan Assumption Process by PNC Bank Dear XXXX XXXX, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against PNC Bank regarding their conduct during the loan assumption process for my mortgage. I believe the bank 's repeated and unnecessary requests for the same documentation are intended to frustrate and delay the process, potentially discouraging me from pursuing the loan assumption altogether. 

Background Information : Bank Name : PNC Bank Loan Number : XXXX Property Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX Type of Loan : Conventional Date of Loan Assumption Application : XX/XX/XXXX Since I began the loan assumption process on XX/XX/XXXX, I have complied with all the requests for documentation made by PNC Bank. Despite submitting all required documents, the bank has repeatedly asked me to resubmit the same paperwork multiple times, without providing any valid explanation for these repeated requests. 

For example, on XX/XX/XXXX I sent XXXX XXXX an email to confirm that I submitted the loan application along with bank statements, proof of employment, and XXXX information for XXXX and XXXX. I also sent all the information associated with my credit and credit cards. Despite these submissions, it wasnt until XX/XX/XXXX when I received a response which stated, PNCs processes were about XXXX days behind. So, I expected a correspondence around XX/XX/XXXX since I submitted in XX/XX/XXXX. While I was waiting, and to satisfy the divorce decree, and to lower my debt to income ratio I pulled money from my investment account to XXXX out all of my credit card debt, as well as pay off XXXX XXXX, which was required via the divorce decree. On XX/XX/XXXX I submitted additional paperwork stating I had a new renter. On XX/XX/XXXX, a new person, XXXX XXXX was assigned to my case and requested more information that was not previously requested in the initial loan assumption application. I never spoke with or had any other type of communication with XXXX XXXX before or after this voicemail was left. Subsequently, XXXX days later I received email correspondence from XXXX XXXX again, which stated my application was denied and incomplete. This was only XXXX days after XXXX XXXX voicemail which I had not listened to, since I was working the night shift. Soon after I followed up with XXXX XXXX again who then stated my debt to income ratio was too high. I reminded her during our conversation that in XXXX after I had paid off all of my debt, and after I accepted a new job with better pay, I also provided documentation which included an offer letter and pay stubs, which should have indicated that my debt to income ratio was only XXXX XXXX  She suggested I then reapply instead of submitting the paperwork back to underwriting. This also led me to believe that she did not read, nor submit any of the documentation I provided in XX/XX/XXXX. Also, on this call she stated that my credit cards were not paid off and that they had pulled my XXXX XXXX in late XXXX, all of which would impact my debt to income ratio. In light of all of this, all of this should have been sent back to underwriting, but instead she chose to have me reapply. 

In XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX was then assigned to my new loan assumption application, and once again I had to submit the same documentation. After I was preliminary approved, she informed me that she feared I did not have enough money for the closing. With this new information I cashed in my XXXX to ensure I had enough money for closing in XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX she also requested proof of where the {$37000.00} originated, as well as requested bank statements from my investment account along with proof that he actually deposited the check from his bank statement. It is now XXXX the XXXX, XXXX and once again, PNC Bank is requesting the same documents all over again. This cycle has continued for a year now causing undue stress and significant delays in the loan assumption process. 

The bank 's conduct has caused emotional distress because I am trying to close this chapter of my life and having to engage my ex husband repeatedly to resign documents that have already been signed, re-engaging and repaying for a notary to notarize the new documents. So, unfortunately, every time I receive documents from PNC I have hoped that they are the closing documents, but instead they are resubmission documents every single time I believe this behavior XXXX be a deliberate attempt to frustrate me to XXXX XXXX of abandoning the loan assumption process, which could be in violation of consumer protection laws and regulations. 

I respectfully request that your office investigate this matter to determine if PNC Bank is engaging in unfair or deceptive practices. Specifically, I would like : - An investigation into the bank 's handling of my loan assumption application. 
- Appropriate corrective actions taken against the bank if found to be in violation of regulations. 
- Any other relief deemed necessary to prevent further harm to myself and other consumers. 

Please find attached copies of all relevant documents, including correspondence with the bank, proof of submissions, and the documentation requested by the bank. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you as a last resort after multiple unsuccessful attempts to resolve a matter of fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports with all three major credit bureaus ( Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ). Despite my repeated efforts, these bureaus continue to violate my rights under multiple federal laws, and I demand immediate action to rectify this situation. 

Violations of Federal Law : Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ] : The credit bureaus are legally required to provide accurate and verifiable information about each item on my credit report. The fraudulent accounts and inquiries listed below are clearly not mine, and the credit bureaus have failed to provide any documentation proving their legitimacy. 

12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) : This regulation mandates that debt collectors must clearly identify the name of the creditor and any information necessary to verify the validity of a debt. The credit bureaus have not complied with this requirement, continuing to report erroneous information without proper verification. 

FCRA Section 605B [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ] : This section allows me to block fraudulent information resulting from identity theft, yet the bureaus have ignored my requests and continue to report the following fraudulent accounts and inquiries : Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX XXXX, Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX Fraudulent Inquiries : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ] : The credit bureaus are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum accuracy of the information they report. Their continued reporting of fraudulent accounts and inquiries, despite my disputes, demonstrates a clear violation of this obligation. 

15 U.S.C. 1692c : This statute prohibits debt collectors from contacting me regarding debts that I have clearly disputed as fraudulent. The credit bureaus persistence in reporting these items amounts to unlawful collection activity. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b : This section outlines permissible purposes for obtaining consumer reports. The inquiries listed above were not authorized by me and constitute unauthorized access to my credit information. 

My Demands : This is my third formal request for the immediate removal of the fraudulent accounts and inquiries from my credit reports. By continuing to report this inaccurate information, the credit bureaus are willfully violating federal law and causing significant harm to my financial standing. 

For each fraudulent item that remains on my credit report after this communication, I will pursue legal action and demand {$1000.00} in statutory damages per item, as well as additional compensation for the pain and suffering caused by the ongoing damage to my credit. Furthermore, I will seek punitive damages for the credit bureaus ' blatant disregard for federal law and my rights as a consumer.

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( CREDITOR NAME ) Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Midland Credit / MCM / Midland Funding LLC Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute and request the removal of an alleged debt from my credit report, which I believe to be fraudulent. I have no knowledge of this account and have never entered into any contractual obligations with your company or the original creditor. 
The reporting inaccuracies concerning this account violate both FCRA and FDCPA regulations. To resolve this matter expeditiously, I require the following documentation : XXXX. Evidence of your authorization under 15 USC 1692 ( e ) and 15 USC 1692 ( f ) for handling this matter. 
XXXX. Legal basis for the collection of this debt. 
XXXX. Proof of your authorization to operate in my state. 
XXXX. Evidence of the alleged debt, including any contracts or agreements bearing my signature. 
XXXX. Complete account history, inclusive of all collection-related charges. 
I am formally filing a complaint citing violations of my consumer rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 602 ( a ), I demand immediate cessation of all communication and collection activities related to this account. Furthermore, per 15 U.S.C. 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), no account can be furnished without my written instructions. 
Your actions have infringed upon my rights under several sections of the FDCPA : * 1692d : Harassment or abuse in connection with debt collection.

* 1692e : Use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations.

* 1692g ( b ) : Failure to properly disclose my rights.

* 1692f : Use of unfair or unconscionable means to collect a debt.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear I am writing to dispute inaccurate information regarding a charge-off account listed on my credit report. I have found multiple inconsistencies in the information reported by the XXXX credit bureaus, and I request an investigation and correction of these discrepancies. 
*Disputed Account Information : * - Creditor : XXXX - Account Number : [ XXXX ) Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these discrepancies and correct any inaccuracies. Please contact the original creditor to verify the correct information. Right to Accurate Information ( FCRA Section 609 ) : Under Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), I have the right to obtain and dispute the completeness and accuracy of the information in my credit report. I request that you investigate and verify the accuracy of the reported charge-off. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed. Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ( FCRA Section 1681i ) : Under Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), I have the right to request a reinvestigation of any information I believe to be incorrect or inaccurate on my credit report. I demand that you review and correct this information immediately.Removal of Inaccurate/Invalidated Credit Information ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) ) : As per Section 611 ( 5 ) of the FCRA, if, after a reinvestigation of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall promptly delete such information from the consumers file.

Responsibilities of Information Providers ( FCRA Section 1681s-2 ) : Under Section 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), information providers must ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported. The inclusion of this incorrect charge-off information represents a clear violation of this section.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This account never been late XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  number XXXX. I have attach the proof of my on time payment. 
It has come to my attention that there are errors on my credit report. Case law in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, courts ruled that information may not seem to be parroted and that a reasonable investigation must take place upon receipt of a consumer complaint. According to the FCRA, when a credit reporting agency receive a dispute the CRA must prove it or fix it. I am demanding the proof be provided that these accounts are in fact late or removed late payment. Simply verifying that names, addresses and/or Social Security numbers match is insufficient. That s what fraud is, using information belonging to someone else to obtain credit. DO NOT tell me I need to file a police report, as there is no requirement to do so under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Is your obligation under the FDCPA to prove it or remove it. In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, the courts said, during a dispute and subsequently investigation, with the original creditor, collector, or a credit bureau, that the original creditor or collector must provide account level documentation. That means an original contract, or similar proof, not just a printout of the payments that were made. I am also notifying you that pursuant to 15 USC 1681 ( a ) that you should be aware that information furnishers have lost number suits and are unreliable. I will wait the appropriate time as prescribed by law at which time I will proceed to protect my good name and avail myself of any and all legal rights, including but not limited to look at auction. Please make the requested corrections on the following account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX number XXXX Please note that I have opted out in writing of your forced arbitration terms and that I am willing to seek legal relief. Please provide me with an update report within the 30 days established by law

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized access and use of my bankruptcy information that was obtained without a permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ). 

I recently discovered that my bankruptcy information was accessed and reported by [ Name of the Entity or Source ], which, to my knowledge, does not have a permissible purpose for accessing this sensitive information. This action is in violation of the FCRA. 

Under 15 USC 1681b, a person or entity must have a permissible purpose to obtain my credit report or related information. As this entity does not meet the requirements for a permissible purpose, I request that you take the following actions : Investigate the unauthorized access and use of my bankruptcy information. 
Remove the bankruptcy information reported by the unauthorized entity from my credit report. 
Provide me with written confirmation of the actions taken and a copy of my updated credit report once the investigation is complete.

Consumer complaint narrative: My account with was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported in 60 days to be removed. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! Delete the late payments from my consumer reports XXXX
