XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Pa, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a copy of my ( Experian, XXXX, or XXXX ) credit report, and I noticed some late payments posted on my credit report : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Your company is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : Co ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Did I give you written instructions to furnish this on my credit report?

Furthermore, the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) Exclusions from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS. -Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term " consumer report '' does not include- ( A ) Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report.

Delete the above late payments from my consumer report, this agency is in violation of 15 USC 1681.

Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which | will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violations Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC 1681 violations for willful noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] Best regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT You XXXX XXXX  are furnishing inaccurate and incorrect information to the consumer reporting agencies. 

The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. 

You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood. 

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. 

PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return.

The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate. 

By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate. 

15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you XXXX XXXX are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. 

You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect in accurate information immediately. 

15 USC 1681 5-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. 
The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union , federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in XXXX XXXX. 

The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2024 publication. 

SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you filled the account as a canceled debt. 

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( il ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. 

The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. 

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report. 

YOU HAVE XXXX Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX

In person : Visit any Wells Fargo branch and speak to a banker. To find a branch near you, visit us online at XXXX By phone : Call us at XXXX, XXXX am EST XXXX pm XXXX, Monday through Friday Thank you, Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX wellsfargo.com | Security Center | Contact Us XXXX I have an appointment tomorrow at Wells Fargo Bank Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Phone : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX bank worker who will help me tomorrow is XXXX XXXX XXXX and her email is XXXX then today I got this email saying Closure of your deposit account ending in XXXX XXXX XXXX Wells Fargo Online to me 3 hours ago details Wells Fargo Home Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX : Wells Fargo performs ongoing reviews of its account relationships in connection with the Banks responsibilities to manage risks in its banking operations. We recently reviewed your account relationship and, as a result of this review, we will be closing your above-referenced accounts because we have made a business decision to end your account relationship because of a pattern of security risks. The accounts are expected to close by XX/XX/XXXX. Please note that the Bank reserves the right to close the accounts sooner if circumstances arise that warrant an earlier closing. Be aware that some circumstances may delay the closure of your accounts. To learn more, refer below to " What may delay account closure? '' Please review the following important information to help you prepare for this transition. What this means for the accounts listed above as of the date of this letter : Deposits have been blocked. If you have recurring deposits ( for example, your paycheck or pension ), please redirect the deposits to a non-Wells Fargo account. If your account balance is or becomes negative and you would like to make a covering deposit or transfer, contact XXXX to arrange for the temporary ability to make a deposit. You may access any available funds until the accounts are closed. We will only authorize new withdrawals or payments from your account if you have sufficient available funds in that account or an account linked for overdraft protection. We must pay certain transactions that are received for processing before your account closes, even if this creates a negative balance in your account. This includes the payment of any previously authorized transactions ( for example, debit card purchases ), but no overdraft fees will be assessed if you do not have sufficient funds in your account. We must also process the reversal of any previously credited deposits that are returned unpaid and may assess a returned deposited item fee. If your account does not have sufficient funds, then previously established recurring payments will be declined and checks will be returned unpaid. While we will not assess an insufficient funds fee on these transactions, the merchant you attempted to pay may assess returned payment fees. Contact these merchants as soon as possible to make other payment arrangements. Any recurring or automatic bill payments set up from our accounts will need to be canceled or changed to a non-Wells Fargo account. You may continue to receive standard Wells Fargo communications or notices regarding your accounts : which may refer to services or features that are no longer applicable to or available on your accounts. Such communications and notices should not be understood as impacting our decision to close your accounts. While overdraft and insufficient funds fees will be waived following the date of this letter, other fees may continue to be assessed by your Account Agreement. What may delay account closure? Account closure may be delayed beyond the date listed above. The most common reasons include : your account having a negative balance, having pending transactions, or being subject to a legal order hold. Once the issue preventing closure is resolved, we will proceed with account closure and send you a final statement. What happens to the balance in your accounts when the account is closed? If the account balance is positive at closure, we will mail a cashier 's check payable to you for all money due to you. We are here to help : If you have questions, please call us at XXXX, Monday through Friday, XXXX a.m. to XXXX p.m., or Saturday, XXXX a.m. to XXXX p.m. XXXX XXXX. Consumer complaint narrative: I did not request anything to be removed off of my credit! This complaint is NOT all about credit inquires on my credit report. This is about XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX committing FRAUD, According to 15 U.S. Code 1605 - Determination of finance charge. The amount of the finance charge in connection with any consumer credit transaction SHALL be determined as the sum of all charges, payable directly or indirectly by the person to whom the credit is extended, and imposed directly or indirectly by the creditor as an incident to the extension of credit. The finance charge DOES NOT include charges of a type payable in a comparable CASH TRANSACTION. With that being said XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is committing fraud by forcing people to pay cash ( Down payments ) in a finance charge, and when they refuse to pay cash down they deny their credit application. This is Disparate Treatment of inconsistent application rules and policies that is being projected on me and violates Truth In Lending and Equal Credit Opportunity Act. At the end of the day, I just want XXXX XXXX to Accept the terms I have provided them with according to the Law, approve my application, and ship the vehicle in the Brochure to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. Thank you very much again.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative: Synchrony Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX ) changed their policy for sending bills in XXXX 2024. I previously received a paper statement in the mail and always paid the bill in full. I was forced to switch to paperless billing or incur an additional monthly fee for the paper statement. This was and remains the only credit card I have that has such a policy. The first paperless bill got lost in the almost one XXXX emails I receive on a daily basis, many of these are spam emails. When I discovered the unpaid bill, I immediately paid it with the current charges at the time. I spoke with customer service ( XXXX, ID # XXXX on XXXX2024 ) and was credited back both the late fee and interest charges as a courtesy. The current bill now shows additional interest and according to the representative for Synchrony Bank, the policy regarding interest also changed on XXXX XXXX 2024. As someone who never carries a balance and always pays every credit card in full, there would be no need for me to find this change in whatever document was supposedly sent. I just received an email today, XXXX XXXX, 2024 from Synchrony Bank, informing me of changes to the terms of the account and to log in to find out what the changes are. They seem to be changing terms at a rapid rate. According to my last bank statement : If you did not pay your balance in full in the prior billing cycle, interest will be calculated on your balance from the first day of the current billing cycle until we receive your payment in full, even if you pay your balance in full and on time and make no new charges in the current billing cycle. This interest, plus interest on that interest, will be reflected on your next billing statement. ( See attached copy ). Synchronys change in policy and paperless billing caused this error. I dont think it is right or fair to pay additional interest charges when I have paid the full balance and they even waived the fees and interest initially. They refuse to address this issue further and in a fair matter ( XX/XX/scrub>/2024 ). I have never encountered a similar situation with any other financial institution. Thank you for your attention to this matter. The New York State Department of Financial Services requested that I contact CFPB.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX PM Account # XXXX, XXXX  XXXX Account # XXXX, XXXX  XXXX Account # XXXX, XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX XXXX, XXXX & XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my Transunion credit report on XX/XX/2024, and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

According to 15 USC 1681 5, they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( I ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

According to 15 USC 1681s-2, they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Improper Handling of Credit Information Dear CFPB Members, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Equifax for the re-insertion of outdated and incorrect personal information in my credit report, despite my prior request for its removal. This situation violates my rights under both federal and state consumer protection laws. 

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. Under this law, Equifax is required to investigate disputes within 30 days and correct or delete any inaccurate or unverifiable information. The re-insertion of incorrect information without proper notification is a direct violation of the FCRA, specifically section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ). 

*MY NAME IS : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX NO HAVE Employment History In the state of XXXX, the XXXX  Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies Act  ( CCCRAA  ), XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX et seq., also protects my rights. This law requires credit reporting agencies to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of information and prohibits the re-insertion of outdated information. Specifically, section XXXX requires credit agencies to investigate and correct errors within 30 days of receiving a dispute. 

Therefore, I request that Equifax : Immediately remove the incorrect and outdated information from my credit report. 
Provide an updated copy of my credit report with the corrections made. 
Ensure that such information is not re-inserted without proper verification. 
If Equifax fails to comply with these requests, I will proceed to take the following actions : File a formal complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to a resolution as outlined above. I am attaching copies of my identification, the relevant credit report, and any supporting documentation for your reference.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi - The name of the mortgage company we have financed our home with is New Rez and since the beginning we have had several problems with them. However today I am reaching out to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding the incorrect property tax paid by New Rez/XXXX XXXX ( New Rez 's supposedly tax department ). It seems mortgage companies are required to collect a monthly amount to be held in escrow so that they can make timely and accurate insurance and tax payments. Unfortunately, these payments have never been made by New Rez on time and the only payment that was done was an erroneous payment. Our home insurance company was going to terminate our insurance because New Rez was not responding to their calls or correspondences, until they reached out to us and we made the payment immediately. Since then we have been trying to close our escrow but when we contacted escrow closure New Rez said we would need to complete a year with New Rez and show that we have paid our taxes before we could close escrow. Therefore, as soon as we received the real estate tax bill, we mailed a check to XXXX XXXX the XXXX XXXX tax collector, for the tax amount indicated on the bill on XX/XX/XXXX. On the same day I sent an email to loanservicing@newrez.com letting them that we have paid our insurance and tax payment that was due and to close our escrow account with New Rez. The next day on XX/XX/XXXX, I called them and informed them the same thing and asked New Rez to stop payment of property tax from escrow. On XX/XX/XXXX I received confirmation from the tax collector that she received our check for the tax payment and was applied to our account. Despite informing New Rez more than once to stop payment, they proceeded to make a duplicate payment of the tax amount from the escrow account. As a result, I have been following up with the tax collector regarding the status of the tax payment received from XXXX XXXX. Tax Collector confirmed that a check numbered XXXX for {$72000.00} was received from XXXX XXXXNew Rez on XX/XX/XXXX, and returned on XX/XX/XXXX via XXXX XXXX ( with tracking number XXXX ). Upon tracking this, it shows that the check returned by the tax collector reached XXXX office on XX/XX/XXXX. However, we have a voice mail from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX continuing to say that they are waiting on the status of confirmation of return of tax payment from the tax collector. We have been chasing New Rez for over 4 months requesting refund of our funds that NewRezXXXX XXXX wrongly expended. New RezXXXX XXXX have been evading by giving frivolous excuses and delaying our refund. 

Request CFPBs intervention at the earliest to help get our money back and maybe even get us compensation for all the agitation that New Rez has caused us over the past weeks to persuade mortgage companies in taking corrective action to prevent such future occurrences. Please let me know what other information you need from us to take this forward. 

To anyone else reading this a word of caution to please choose your mortgage company wisely if you don't want to run into issues until the mortgage is paid off.

Product: Credit card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I made an online purchase with XXXX. For the form of payment I chose to use my XXXX XXXX store credit card ( Managed by TD Bank ). The order number generated by XXXX was XXXX. 

Later that same day I cancelled the order since I no longer wanted the item previously purchased. I received a confirmation email from XXXX that the cancellation had been successfully processed. 

Double checking my credit card transaction history, I noticed that XXXX different charges related with the cancelled order XXXX had been made to my credit card and had not been reversed. 

I proceeded to call TD Bank to see why this was happening and they told the I had to contact XXXX. I called XXXX and they told me that the had already refunded the money and that I should wait a few more days for it to be reflected. I asked them if they could reach out to TD Bank and let them know, but the said they couldn't do that and that I would have to call them myself. 

I waited a few more days and the charges had not been reversed/refunded. I called XXXX more time to TD Bank and asked to speak to a supervisor. I was kept waiting but never actually transferred to any supervisor. Instead the agent told me that she had spoken with a supervisor and that they would investigate this. I asked for a case number or reference that I could follow up but she told me there was no case number and that I had to wait for them to investigate and that I should receive a letter in my mailbox. I have not received it yet. 

I called XXXX one more time to see what was going on and I asked to speak to a supervisor. Once transferred to XXXX, I was told that they had already made the refund. I was sent an email with the alleged refunds. 

To this day the refunds have not been posted and the latest credit card statement has been generated and have balance of {$1400.00} for an order I had already cancelled on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I have also reached XXXX by chat and didn't get a successful solution to this issue. Basically I have been going back and forth between XXXX and TD Bank and nobody has been able to fix this issue. I will not be paying for this balance nor any interest associated with it since I have already cancelled this purchase on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am attaching call logs with XXXX and TD Bank, emails, chats, screenshots, credit card statement. I don't know what else I can do for them to fix this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ).

Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$8400.00} I previously submitted a dispute to Equifax regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, [ Equifax ] failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report.

As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Equifax failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Equifax for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Equifax upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than XXXX years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I want to stress that I did not give written permission for these specific transactions to be included in my consumer report. At no point did I authorize these entries, and their presence on my report is unwarranted. Consequently, I am formally requesting that these accounts be blocked and removed from my report immediately.

It is important to clarify that this request is not due to any error or negligence on my part. There has been no oversight or misunderstanding on my end. Instead, this issue arises solely from the fact that I did not explicitly authorize the inclusion of these transactions in my report. I am diligent about maintaining the accuracy and privacy of my financial records, and these unauthorized entries compromise that integrity.

I trust that you will handle this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. Please confirm the removal of these transactions from my report as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: My account with was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported in 60 days to be removed. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! Delete the late payments from my consumer reports XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX sent me this so I'm trying to understand why is this still reporting on my file. 
We are writing in response to the above-referenced complaint. XXXX works for creditors as a third-party agent and legally relies upon the information provided. We do not own the account in question and never purchase debt. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX placed an account with us for collection or we would not have contacted the consumer. If the account was disputed or fraud was alleged prior to placement with XXXX, we were not advised. Prior to our receipt of this complaint, XXXX had already ceased collection efforts. XXXX received a XXXX XXXX XXXX complaint disputing the account. XXXX promptly ceased collection efforts and noted the account as disputed. XXXX obtained and mailed validation of debt, provided by the creditor, on XX/XX/XXXX. The documents were mailed to the address matching what is on this complaint. Despite sending validation, XXXX did not resume collection efforts. Any credit reporting provided by XXXX was deleted at that time. XXXX has closed the account in it system as disputed and it will be returned to the creditor. XXXX next received this complaint which suggests the possibility of fraud. If XXXX XXXX believes they may have been the victim of identity theft, we would advise them to complete the following process. Every creditor has its own required fraud process to permanently close accounts. XXXX requires a XXXX XXXX to be completed and returned to them directly by the consumer. Please ask XXXX XXXX to call the XXXX XXXX Department at : XXXX or visit : https : //www.xfinity.com/idtheftclaimform. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance. Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. 

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, XXXX has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand. 

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being. 

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors. 

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681, section 602 ( a ) emphasizes the importance of consumer reporting agencies acting responsibly with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for consumer privacy. XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is protected. This right is reinforced by 15 USC 6801, which mandates that financial institutions respect the privacy of their customers and protect the confidentiality of their nonpublic personal information. As per 15 USC 1681, section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report with the written consent of the consumer. I have not given Equifax, XXXX, XXXX, or any financial institution my written consent to share my information. Therefore, any consent previously given, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. According to 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), financial institutions must inform consumers of their right to opt out of the disclosure of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties. I was not informed of this right by the information furnishers to credit agencies. Additionally, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include adverse information in a consumer report that is older than seven years, except for records of convictions of crimes. The adverse account being reported by Equifax and XXXX is without my permission and is against the law. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that a person should not furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. Also, 15 USC 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain procedures to prevent violations of section 1681c and to ensure that reports are furnished only for permissible purposes. XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX are failing to maintain these procedures. Lastly, under 12 CFR 1016.7, a consumer has the right to opt out at any time. I am exercising my right to opt out of the reporting services of XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXXXXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX SSN : XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Medical Collection Account - Account # XXXX Account Name : First XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Equifax XXXX Department XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and validity of a medical collection account listed on my credit report under the name First XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number XXXX. 
Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1692j, it is unlawful to design, compile, and furnish any form knowing that such form would be used to create the false belief that a person other than the creditor is participating in the collection of or an attempt to collect a debt, when in fact that person is not participating. This provision was enacted to protect consumers from deceptive practices in the collection of debts. 
In my case, the account in question appears to involve deceptive practices as outlined in the statute. There is reason to believe that this account may have been furnished under misleading circumstances, potentially implying involvement from parties not actually associated with the original creditor.

Furthermore, there is case law supporting the protections under 15 U.S. Code 1692j, which underscores the illegality of such deceptive practices. I request that this account be thoroughly investigated for compliance with federal law. If any violations are found, I ask for its immediate removal from my credit report. 
Please provide me with written confirmation of your receipt of this dispute and the subsequent results of your investigation. Additionally, if you require any further information from me to facilitate this investigation, please let me know promptly. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

To my knowledge this fraudulent accounts were open without my consent I respectfully request that this these unauthorized accounts be investigated and I urge you to remove it from my credit report immediately please provide me with any available information regarding the accounts including the account details please also inform me in writing that the fraudulent accounts have been removed from my credit report thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ATTACHED IS A CURRENT AND ACTIVE LAWSUIT ON FILE FOR EQUIFAX DUE TO WILLFUL NON COMPLIANCE OF FEDERAL LAWS THAT PROTECT MY RIGHTS AS A CONSUMER. 15 U.S. Code 1666B : The law clearly states that a creditor may not treat any payment on an account under an open-end consumer credit plan as LATE for any purpose, unless they send the information in section 1637B. Equifax re-investigation DOES NOT PROVIDE THE PROCEDURES IN THE RE-INVESTIGATION. IT only states updated and verified. The re-investigation should have detailed information and proof that the creditor mailed off the information listed in 1637B 21 Days before the payment was due. I have requested a description of the investigation procedure 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 7 ) several times with no evidence of a true re-investigation.

Pursuant to Fair Debt Collection Practices Act " Late payments must be validated prior to them being placed on a credit report '' This is willful failure to comply with the law and this makes Equifax criminally liable for actual, statutory, and punitive damages due to my rights being violated under FCRA.

15 U.S. Code 1681 ( G ) ( A ) 1 : The law says there is a description of the procedure attached to my file and I have the right to request all of the information in the file and Equifax has failed to do so. 

15 U.S. Code 6802- Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information.

Transactions are payment histories, hard inquires, new open accounts, student loans, and charge offs are all personal information. This law protects my rights from any non-affiliated 3rd party company. Equifax is a non-affiliated 3rd party company reporting my personal and nonpublic information in their database without my consent. Nonpublic information means personal identifiable information. I would like to have documents and disclosure forms stating that I gave Equifax the right to report my personal information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the following accounts, which have been inaccurately reported on my credit reports by XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX. These accounts are not mine, and their presence on my credit report constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Account # XXXX I would like to bring to your attention that these unauthorized accounts have violated my rights under the FCRA as follows : Right to Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ) : According to this section, I have the right to privacy regarding my personal credit information. The reporting of these unauthorized accounts on my credit report breaches this right, as I did not consent to their inclusion.

Furnishing of Accounts Without My Written Instructions ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : The FCRA clearly states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. I have never provided any authorization or instruction for these accounts to be reported under my name. 

These violations have caused significant distress and potential harm to my financial standing. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure that the unauthorized accounts are removed from my credit reports. Additionally, I request that any necessary corrective action be taken against the responsible parties to prevent future violations of my rights. 

Enclosed with this letter are copies of my credit reports from XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX, highlighting the unauthorized accounts. I have also included any relevant correspondence that may assist in the investigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I trust that the CFPB will take swift action to resolve this issue and uphold the protections guaranteed to me under the FCRA. Please feel free to contact me if you require any additional information or documentation. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and Detailed Description of Verification Methods Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the handling of my credit report dispute by XXXX XXXX, and Equifax. Despite my efforts to resolve inaccuracies on my credit report, I have encountered several issues that I believe warrant further investigation by the CFPB. 
Background : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a dispute to XXXX XXXX, and Equifax regarding inaccurate information on my credit report. The items in question were not properly verified, yet the agency concluded that the information was accurate. I am concerned about the thoroughness and accuracy of their reinvestigation process.

Details of the Complaint : 1. Inadequate Verification Process : Despite my detailed dispute, the credit reporting agency failed to verify the accuracy of the disputed information adequately. The verification process seems to lack transparency and thoroughness, which raises concerns about its compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

2. Lack of Detailed Verification Methods : I requested a detailed description of the verification methods used by the credit reporting agency, including the specific procedures, sources consulted, documentation reviewed, and criteria for validation. However, this information has not been provided, despite multiple requests.

3. Timeline of Investigation : There is a lack of clarity on the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken during the process. This lack of transparency hinders my ability to understand how the investigation was conducted and whether it adhered to FCRA requirements.

I did not approve these transactions to be included in my consumer report, neither in writing nor verbally. Therefore, I formally request that these accounts be blocked and removed from my record. This is not a mistake or a misrepresentation. These transactions were included without my explicit consent or instruction. 

I am stressing this to highlight the seriousness of my request. It is based on accurate information, and I am not attempting to deceive or manipulate the situation in any way. My intent is solely to ensure that my consumer report reflects only those transactions that I have authorized. I am committed to maintaining the integrity of my financial records and ensuring that they are accurate and truthful. My request is genuine and aimed at correcting an unauthorized inclusion, not at exploiting any system or misleading any party involved.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. 

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, XXXX has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand. 

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being. 

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors. 

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer. 

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Formal Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of FCRA Section 623 Due to Reinsertion of Previously Deleted Account XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion for violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 623, by reinserting an account that was previously deleted from my credit report due to inaccuracy and discrepancy, THIS IS A VIOLATIONG TO THE LAWS Violation of 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), Violation of 607 ( b ) AND Violation of 611 ( d ).

Account Number : [ XXXX XXXX ] Report Date : [ XX/XX/year> ] I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion LLC regarding the reinsertion of an account that was previously removed from my credit report due to inaccuracy in THE DATE ( XX/XX/year> ) AFTER THEY HAD RECEIVED ( ATTACH : THIS IS THE LETTER SENT TO THE XXXX DISPUTING THE INACCURACIES ) XX/XX/year> REGARDING THE VIOLATION AND INACCURACIES THAT THE ACCOUNT HAD ON XX/XX/year>, TRANSUNION SENT ME THE NOTIFICATION OF THE DELETION OF THE ACCOUNT ( XXXX XXXX ) TO WHICH I AM ADDING PROOF THAT IT WAS SUCCESSFULLY REMOVED, BASED ON THE INACCURACIES AND DISCREPANCY THAT IT HAD BEFORE THE 30 DAYS OF THE INVESTIGATION HAD COMPLETED. 

Background On [ Date XX/XX/year> ], I disputed an account listed on my credit report with TransUnion because the information was inaccurate. After a thorough investigation, TransUnion removed the account from my credit report in the ( date XX/XX/year> ), acknowledging the inaccuracy. 

However, on [ XX/XX/year> ], ( attach proof the reinsertion account ) I discovered that TransUnion had reinserted the previously deleted account into my credit report without proper notification or verification of the accuracy of the information. This action directly violates my rights under the FCRA.

This reinsertion has been done in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The specific sections of the FCRA that have been violated are as follows : Violation of Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) - Reinsertion of Disputed Information : According to this section of the FCRA, if an item is deleted due to inaccuracy, it can not be reinserted into the credit report unless the information provider certifies that the information is complete and accurate. TransUnion did not provide me with any such certification or notification within the five business days required by law. Furthermore, the consumer must be notified in writing within five business days if the information is reinserted.

In this case, the account identified as [ XXXX XXXX ] was previously removed from my credit report after I disputed its accuracy. However, TransUnion has reinserted this account without providing me with any verification of its accuracy or completeness, nor did I receive any notification from TransUnion within the required five-day period.

2.Violation of Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Duty to Correct and Update Information : Under this section, the furnisher of the information has a duty to correct and update the information that is found to be inaccurate. The reinsertion of the previously removed account, without correcting the inaccuracy that led to its removal, constitutes a clear violation of this duty.

3.Violation of Section 611 ( d ) - Notification of Reinsertion : This section mandates that when a previously deleted item is reinserted, the credit bureau must notify the consumer in writing and provide a summary of their rights under the FCRA. TransUnion failed to provide any such notification, leaving me unaware of the reinsertion until I checked my report. REMOVE INMEDIATLY THE ACCOUNT FOR VIOLATION TO MY RIGHT.

TransUnion has failed to provide me with the required written notice and summary of my rights after reinserting the account. This failure constitutes a direct violation of my rights under the FCRA.

4. Violation of 607 ( b ) Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA requires credit bureaus to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. By reinserting an account that was previously removed due to inaccuracy, TransUnion has demonstrated a failure to adhere to these procedures, resulting in a report that does not reflect accurate or reliable information.

Harm Caused The unauthorized reinsertion of this inaccurate account has caused significant harm, including potential damage to my credit score, increased stress, and the need to spend additional time and resources to correct the error. This has affected my ability to obtain credit on favorable terms and caused undue distress. Am very sad because is in the process to buy my home for my childs. please help that imposible than ONLY TRANSUNION REINSERT THIS ACCOUNT XXXX AND XXXX WAS DELETE DEFINITELY FOR INNACURATE THE PROOF IS ATTACH IN THIS COMPLAINT. AND THE PICTURES IS VERY CLEAR.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion regarding their refusal to investigate and correct inaccurate information on my credit report, as detailed in their recent message to me dated XX/XX/year>, under File Number : XXXX. 

Background : I recently initiated a dispute with TransUnion to correct inaccuracies in my credit report. However, I received a response from TransUnion stating that they did not process my request because they claimed it did not appear to come directly from me or a properly authorized third party. This is inaccurate, as I submitted the dispute myself and have not engaged any third-party services to handle my credit disputes. Furthermore, the inaccuracies on my credit report are having a significant negative impact on my credit score and my ability to secure a mortgage, as I am in the process of purchasing a home. 

Issues : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), TransUnion is required to conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information on their credit report. TransUnions refusal to investigate based on their incorrect assumption that my request was not submitted directly by me is a clear violation of this provision. 

2. Right to Accurate Credit Reporting : The FCRA also stipulates that credit reporting agencies must report accurate information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The inaccurate items on my credit report have not been addressed, despite my legitimate dispute. This failure to correct inaccurate information is damaging my creditworthiness and is preventing me from accessing essential financial opportunities. 

3. Potential Violation of Consumer Rights : TransUnions suggestion that I may be working with an unauthorized third party, and their failure to act on my legitimate dispute, not only delays the correction of inaccuracies but also implies a potential violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. 

Requested Resolution : I am requesting the CFPBs assistance to ensure that TransUnion : 1. Immediately conducts a thorough and reasonable investigation into the disputed items on my credit report, as per FCRA requirements.

2. Corrects or deletes the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provides a detailed explanation of the steps they took to investigate my dispute and the rationale behind their decisions. 

The inaccurate information on my credit report is unfairly hindering my ability to purchase a home, and I seek prompt resolution of this matter. 

Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring that my rights under the FCRA are upheld.

Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681, section 602 ( a ) emphasizes the importance of consumer reporting agencies acting responsibly with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for consumer privacy. Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and as a consumer, I have the right to ensure that my private information is protected. This right is reinforced by XXXX XXXX XXXX, which mandates that financial institutions respect the privacy of their customers and protect the confidentiality of their nonpublic personal information. As per 15 USC 1681, section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer report with the written consent of the consumer. I have not given XXXX, XXXX, Transunion, or any financial institution my written consent to share my information. Therefore, any consent previously given, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. According to 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), financial institutions must inform consumers of their right to opt out of the disclosure of their nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties. I was not informed of this right by the information furnishers to credit agencies. Additionally, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include adverse information in a consumer report that is older than XXXX years, except for records of convictions of crimes. The adverse account being reported by XXXX and XXXX is without my permission and is against the law. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that a person should not furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. Also, 15 USC 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain procedures to prevent violations of section 1681c and to ensure that reports are furnished only for permissible purposes. Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX are failing to maintain these procedures. Lastly, under 12 CFR 1016.7, a consumer has the right to opt out at any time. I am exercising my right to opt out of the reporting services of Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Transunion for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 
Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$9900.00} XXXX previously submitted a dispute to Transunion regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Transunion failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 
As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Transunion failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 
I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Transunion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Transunion upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Furthermore, 15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that a person should not furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. Also, 15 USC 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain procedures to prevent violations of section 1681c and to ensure that reports are furnished only for permissible purposes. Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX are failing to maintain these procedures. Lastly, under 12 CFR 1016.7, a consumer has the right to opt out at any time. I am exercising my right to opt out of the reporting services of Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against TransUnion for inaccurately reporting my account status with XXXX XXXX. Currently, I am on a payment plan with XXXX XXXX, and both XXXX and XXXX are accurately reflecting this arrangement in their reports. However, TransUnion has marked this account as adverse, which is incorrect. 

This misreporting by TransUnion is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ). This section requires credit reporting agencies to maintain maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. By inaccurately reporting my account as adverse, despite my adherence to a payment plan, TransUnion has failed to comply with the statutory requirements of the FCRA.

This inaccuracy has negatively impacted my credit score, causing undue stress and potential financial repercussions. I have made multiple attempts to rectify this issue directly with TransUnion, but the incorrect information persists on my credit report. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) intervene to ensure TransUnion corrects this inaccuracy within 15 business days as mandated by the FCRA. Immediate action is necessary to prevent further damage to my credit and to uphold my consumer rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. 

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, TransUnion has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand. 

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being. 

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors. 

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer. 

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaint Right to Privacy In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The ( 16 ) accounts listed below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality contrary to : Title 15 of the United States Code section 1681 ; 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A ; 15 U.S.C 1681 section604 A Section 2 ; 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( A ) ( 5 ) ; and, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaint Right to Privacy According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 A states " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am a Consumer with the right to make sure my private information isn't shared, see : 15 USC 6801 which provides : It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title.

15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2, which states : " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX are wanting consent to furnish information. Nor do they have written consent. Any and all, perceived or otherwise, consent to TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise are hereby revoked.

15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option.

15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. These accounts are inaccurate, are adverse items reporting without permission, of which are against the law.

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) makes clear : A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S. Code 1681e states that Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. 

TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, hereby opting out of the reporting services. 

The List of accounts Account names : Account numbers : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Respectfully Submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> 2024

Consumer complaint narrative: This letter is to provide you with knowledge of intent to sue. The lawsuit will filed due to the utter lack of response from your company. When someone is the victim of identity theft, it is simply a nightmare trying to get false information removed from a credit file. I have contacted all of the false creditors listed on my credit file. I have challenged all of the false listings on my credit file. Nothing ever happens to fix the situation. Over 90 days ago I wrote each the creditors in question and demanded proof that I am their customer. I asked for proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. So far none of them has been able to provide such proof to me. I have sent follow-up letters to each of them and there is still no proof. I have attempted phone contact, but I simply get transferred around and nothing ever gets accomplished. I have fully investigated my rights in this matter. Under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXX v XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. I have copies of the certified letters and dates prepared to bring to court. Also, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, if they can not verify the debt within 30 days, then it must be removed. Your letters to me claim to have " verified '' the debt, but this is in fact not true under law. Simply contacting the alleged creditor and asking them to match up numbers in their database is no sufficient verification for identity theft. Of course the information matches up. Someone clearly used my information without my authorization. Now I am suing XXXX for being such a pain in the posterior to me. I have provided more than sufficient evidence to get these false accounts removed. Feel free to reach out to address this issue before it escalates legally.. via letter at my address listed at the top of this letter. This matter can be settled simply by your agreement to remove the false information from my credit file. I require a response, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner. If I get another pointless letter from you saying that it has already been " verified '' then there will be no more opportunity for negotiation. This will proceed in court until I have successfully proven to a judge that this false information must be removed from my credit file. I will also be aggressively pursuing the full judgment that I can get against XXXX for violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Defamation. Accounts that I didn't authorize and had no knowledge of or reporting accurately, police report and FTC report is on file, Please DELETE THEM Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Moreover, I am also concerned about the security of my personal data, as it was affected by the XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion data breach.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> : I filed a CFPB complaint against Transunion for reporting fraudulent accounts and hard inquiries on my credit report as a result of identity theft and Fraud. Compliant # XXXX. 
1. TRANSUNION failed to complete my investigation within 30 days. The investigation was completed on XX/XX/year>. 
This complaint demanded that the listed information be removed from my TRANSUNION credit report within 4 business days and for my credit report to be updated immediately according to FCRA US. Violating my rights under FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 ) -Block of information resulting from identity theft.

TRANSUNION violated my rights under the FCRA by failing to remove all items on my credit report as a result of identity theft and Fraud. 

2. The CFPB complaint was closed XXXX, XXXX, 2024. With a response type of Closed with non-monetary relief.

3.

TRANSUNION RESPONSE TO CFPB COMPLAINT ON XX/XX/year>2024 In response to your request, the following actions were taken on your credit file : You disputed the following accounts and/or public records on your credit file. Below includes the results of that investigation. XXXX XXXX XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-UPDATED XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX XXXX/ XXXX XXXXVERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXXDELETED XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX-DELETED ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX  XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXXXXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-DELETED Other miscellaneous actions take based on your request were : Inquiry DELETED DESCRIPTION OF NON-MONETARY RELIEF In response to your request, the following actions were taken on your credit file : You disputed the following accounts and/or public records on your credit file. Below includes the results of that investigation. FXXXX XXXX XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-UPDATED XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXX-VERIFIED AS REPORTED XXXX XXXX XXXX-DELETED XXXX XXXXDELETED XXXX XXXX-DELETED Other miscellaneous actions take based on your request were : Inquiry DELETED 4. On XX/XX/year>2024 TRANSUNION failed to remove the items listed in their CFPB response in section 2 above and update my credit file. 

5. XX/XX/scrub> 2024. I received a alert today that my Transunion score has dropped XXXX points because the account the TRANSUNION stated was deleted ( XXXX XXXX ) was added to my credit report. 

TRANSUNION failed to provide certification of accuracy of information from the furnisher. Violating my rights under FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( i ) - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy. 

TRANSUNION failed to notify me of this reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. Violating my rights under FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( ii ) - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy.

After providing TRANSUNION with disputes ; 5 FTC identity theft reports ( XXXX ) ; 2 police reports ; and CFPB complaint via certified mail, as well as the response TRANSUNION provided the CFPB on XX/XX/year> following their own thorough investigation, TRANSUNION is aware that are violating my rights under the FCRA because it is the duty to ensure to provide maximum accuracy when reporting information on any consumer file. Violating my rights under FCRA 15 USC 1681 I ( 5 ) ( a ) ( i ) - Treatment of inaccurate and unverifiable information. 


6. As of XX/XX/year>2024 I cant access my TRANSUION report via the Transunion website. XXXX has blocked me from pulling my TRANSUNION credit report. I have contacted TRANSUNION several times this week via phone, chat, and text support for multiple things. And the only thing they advise is to file another dispute.

Due to the reasons listed in sections 1-6 listed above in this complaint TRANSUNION in violation of my right under the following FCRA laws : 1. FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 ) -Block of information resulting from identity theft.

2. FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( i ) 3. FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( ii ) 4. 15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( A ) - Right to Privacy 5. 15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( A ) Section 2- States a consumer reporting agency can not furnis15an account without my written consent and instructions.

6. Defamation of Character 7. Negligent Enhancement of Identity Fraud 8. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 9. Violation under 15 U.S. Code 1681o- Civil liability for negligent non compliance 10. Violation under 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) - Civil liability for willful non-compliance 11. Failing to comply with 15 U.S. Code1692 ( g ) 12. Violation under 15 U.S. Code 1681b- Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 13. Under 15 U.S.C 1681i ( 7 ) - Method of Verification 14. Violations under U.S.C 1681a ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy 15. Violations under 15 U.S. Code 1681c- Requirements Relating to Information Contained in Consumer Reports.

FCRA15 USC 1681n 15 USC 1681n ( 1 ) ( a ) and ( b ) Civil liability for willful noncompliance and FCRA 15 USC 1681n ( 2 ) ( b ) -Civil liability for knowing noncompliance states : Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

I am exercising my rights under of the FCRA laws listed in this complaint. I am demanding that Transunion provides me the consumer both monetary damages up to the maximum of {$1000.00} per violation ( {$15000.00} ) and non-monetary relief by PERMANENTLY REMOVING ALL ITEMS from CFPB response to complaint # XXXX and for my CREDIT REPORT to be updated within 4 business days of this complaint. And lastly, for TRANSUNION to notify and contact me WHEN ALL PREVIOUSLY REMOVED and NEW CREDITORS FURNISH TRANSUNION INFORMATION BEING ADDED TO MY CREDIT REPORT TO CONFIRM ACCURACY BEFORE REPORTING!
