Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been reviewing my credit report and noticed several inaccuracies and incomplete information, specifically concerning the account with XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, this account was removed from my TransUnion credit report, only to be re-added the following day, XX/XX/XXXX. This action is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ( B ) ( 2 ) ( 3 ).

Furthermore, I am deeply concerned that TransUnion has failed to fulfill its obligation to ensure maximum possible accuracy in reporting this account, as mandated by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). I have disputed this account multiple times, including filing identity theft reports with both the FTC and CFPB, yet the issue remains unresolved. 

This continued inaccurate reporting not only violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act but also infringes upon my rights under The Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ). I demand that XXXX XXXX XXXX be permanently deleted from my credit report immediately to rectify this situation. 

Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) Important Definitions ( 4 ) the term record means any item, collection, or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency, including, but not limited to, his education, financial transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history and that contains his name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particular assigned to the individual, such as a finger or voice print or a photograph ; This includes consumer reports ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be ( 12 ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with section 3711 ( e ) of title 31.

Again they need prior written instruction of the individual to whom it relates. 
Section 3711 ( e ) of title 31 States ( 1 ) When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ( 26 U.S.C. 1 et seq. ), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if ( E ) the head of the agency has established procedures to ( iii ) get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information ; and Either way they have violated not only the Fair Credit Reporting Act but also the Privacy Act of 1974 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. ", I AM EXERCISING MY RIGHT TO OPT OUT OF XXXX XXXX XXXX FURNISHING OF INFORMATION TO MY TRANSUNION, XXXX AND XXXX XXXX REPORT. ANY AND ALL CONSENT WHETHER IT BE VERBAL, NON-VERBAL, WRITTEN, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE IS NOW REVOKED ONCE THIS COMPLAINT IS RECEIVED.

Consumer complaint narrative: Dear I am writing to dispute inaccurate information regarding a charge-off account listed on my credit report. I have found multiple inconsistencies in the information reported by the XXXX credit bureaus, and I request an investigation and correction of these discrepancies. *Disputed Account Information : * - Creditor : XXXX - Account Number : [ XXXX ) Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these discrepancies and correct any inaccuracies. Please contact the original creditor to verify the correct information. Right to Accurate Information ( FCRA Section 609 ) : Under Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), I have the right to obtain and dispute the completeness and accuracy of the information in my credit report. I request that you investigate and verify the accuracy of the reported charge-off. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed. Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ( FCRA Section 1681i ) : Under Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), I have the right to request a reinvestigation of any information I believe to be incorrect or inaccurate on my credit report. I demand that you review and correct this information immediately.Removal of Inaccurate/Invalidated Credit Information ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) ) : As per Section 611 ( 5 ) of the FCRA, if, after a reinvestigation of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall promptly delete such information from the consumers file. Responsibilities of Information Providers ( FCRA Section 1681s-2 ) : Under Section 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), information providers must ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported. The inclusion of this incorrect charge-off information represents a clear violation of this section.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received your stall letter regarding the investigation of my previous dispute, and I cant help but feel extremely frustrated and annoyed. Seriously, how much longer are they going to drag this out? 
I submitted a dispute XXXX to challenge information on my credit report. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) -15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a6 ) & 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a7 ), you're supposed to investigate and respond promptly. But all I got was a generic stall letter with no real updates or progress. What gives? 
Ive done some research and found a CFPB report that specified youre using automated methods to send automatic stall letters to consumers in hopes that they will use your online systems for disputing. There is no law saying I cant leverage todays available technology to help me analyze, create and send disputes to transunion. 
Here is a link to the report that detailed TransUnion violations - https : //www.consumerfinance.gov/about-us/newsroom/cfpb-issues-report-on-transunion-experia n-and-equifax/ Listen, I don't have time for your runaround. They need to get your act together and actually do their job. The FCRA clearly states that Transunion have to investigate within 30 days and provide a timely response. It's not rocket science!

TransUnion is in violation of FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ) regarding the re-insertion of previously deleted material : * 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ( B ) ( ii ) mandates that I should have been notified in writing within five business days of the reinsertion. I received no such notice.

* 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ( B ) ( iii ) requires that TransUnion provide the business name and address of the furnisher of information and their contact details, which were not provided to me.

* 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ( B ) ( i ) prohibits the reinsertion of deleted information unless the furnisher certifies the accuracy of the information. There is no indication that this requirement was fulfilled.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

TransUnion po box 2000 Chester PA 19016-2000 RE : You Violated the United States Code Law NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors i see you are disregarding it so heres my breakdown. 
1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

1 of 4 Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you.

Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
XXXX have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. 
Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ).

I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate and they are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied i am in distress because of your mistakes.

The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumeras a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of 3 of 4 any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. ( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agencyfor actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

I am writing to dispute the accuracy of an item that has recently reappeared on my credit report. Specifically, the negative item reported by XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX has reappeared without any notification, contrary to the protections afforded to me under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ).

Relevant Information : This negative item was previously removed from my credit report.

I was not notified of its reappearance, which is a violation of the FCRA 's requirements for consumer notification. 
\ Details of the Disputed Item : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Notification to the Consumer : If the item is reinserted, the credit reporting agency is required to notify you within five business days. The notice must include the following : That the item has been reinserted.

The name, address, and telephone number of the creditor or furnisher of the information.

Your right to request a free copy of your credit report and to add a statement disputing the accuracy or completeness of the information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Trans Union LLC Consumer Dispute Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting inaccurate and incomplete credit information.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) Compliance and procedures ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
Otherwise, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 
I demand to see verifiable proof ( an original consumer contract with my signature on it ) that you have on file for the account listed below. Or a Certification from the creditor that certified the accuracy and completeness of the information/account. 
Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be DELETED and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must DELETE the account listed below. 
I demand that the following account be validated or DELETED immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX In addition, DELETE all non-account holding inquiries over 30 days old. Also, please add a promotional suppression to my credit file. 
Under federal law, you have thirty ( 30 ) days to complete your re-investigation. Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. 

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, TransUnion has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand. 

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being. 

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors. 

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer. 

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT You Discover Bank are furnishing inaccurate and incorrect information to the consumer reporting agencies. 

The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. 

You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood.

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. 

PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return.

The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate.

By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate.

15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you XXXXXXXX XXXX are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency.

You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect in accurate information immediately.

15 USC 1681 5-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. 
The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union , federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in chapter 1.

The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2024 publication.

SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you filled the account as a canceled debt.

15 U.S. Code 16815-2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if- ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( il ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information.

The information is, in fact, inaccurate.

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. 

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report.

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, TransUnion has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand.

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being.

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors.

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found.

The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer.

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.

Here is a summary of your major rights under FCRA. For more information, including information about additional rights, go to www.consumerfinance.gov/XXXX or write to : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, 1700 G Street NW, Washington, DC 20552.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported in 60 days to be removed. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! Delete the late payments from my consumer reports XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am rejecting this response because : The Credit Bureau recent response to my complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report.

Despite my numerous attempts to dispute these erroneous accounts and rectify the situation, XXXX has failed to adequately address and resolve the issues at hand.

Over the past several months, I have repeatedly contacted The Credit Bureau, providing detailed information and supporting documentation to demonstrate the inaccuracies present in my credit report. Unfortunately, each attempt has been met with insufficient action and a lack of proper investigation into the matters I raised. This ongoing negligence has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and has had adverse effects on my financial well-being.

I am now seeking the intervention and assistance of the CFPB to help resolve these persistent issues. The Credit Bureau failure to correct these inaccuracies and conduct a thorough investigation is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, they have breached my consumer rights to a fair and accurate credit report by not fulfilling their obligation to investigate disputes properly and correct any errors.

The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate disputed information and make corrections if inaccuracies are found.

The Credit Bureau continuous disregard for this responsibility has not only violated my rights but has also perpetuated the damages being done to me as a consumer.

I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure that The Credit Bureau adheres to the FCRAs requirements and conducts a comprehensive review of my disputes. I am seeking a resolution that includes the correction of all inaccuracies on my credit report and a guarantee that my consumer rights will be respected moving forward.

I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within >>>>>>4 BUSINESS DAYS<<<<<<<<<pursuant to 605C of the Fair Reporting Credit Act. I am a victim of XXXX XXXX of debt bondange and would like for all listed accounts to be blocked and removed from Equifax. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$1300.00} According to the FCRA, specifically : 1. **Section 605B** : Requires the deletion of information resulting from identity theft. 2. **Section 611** : Provides the right to dispute information in my credit file. 3. **Section 623** : Requires that furnishers of information to credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information provided. 4. 15 USC 1681 Section 602 states I have a right to privacy. 5. **15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ) Section 2 states a credit reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. 6. 15 USC 1666 ( b ) a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to Despite my previous attempts to resolve this issue with both the creditor and your agency, the inaccuracies remain on my report. In addition, please note that if this matter is not resolved promptly, I will be compelled to escalate my complaint to the Attorney General 's office. This step is necessary due to the multiple failed attempts to address this matter through the proper channels. I will be waiting for 30 days before I escalate this matter any further ( FRCA section 611 ( A ) ( 1 ) .According to FRCA Section 604 ( A ) ( 3 ), please provide proof of signature giving the the approval to pull my credit report, run my credit report, or do any kind of business. If you can not verify the debt, please remove this off my account for the THIRD TIME!!! According to FRCA section 605 ( c ) you are in error by even updating this account! I am disputing all inaccuracies including my address.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Based on, 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account is in violation not reporting XXXX XXXX accurate.. This section requires that if an item is disputed, the credit reporting agency must promptly update the item in accordance with the results of its investigation. I request that you conduct a thorough investigation and update or remove the disputed items as necessary. 

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : This section mandates that a credit reporting agency must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumers credit report. The information currently reported is inaccurate and, therefore, does not comply with this requirement. 

Pursuant 15 USC 1681 section 602 A states I have the right to privacy.15 U.S.C . 602 ( a ) : This section obligates credit reporting agencies to use their services for the purpose of credit reporting and to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure that their reports are accurate. The inaccurate entries on my credit report indicate a failure to comply with these procedures. 

Pursuant 15 USC 1681 section 604A section 2 : It also states a consumer agency can not furnish accounts without my written instructions I am requesting the original copy of agreement, terms & conditions. Failure to comply will forfeit your claims and will require you to delete all the listed items on the attached document. You are required to do what I am asking and XXXX these transactions from my consumer report within 4 days.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute an unauthorized access to my credit report, which I believe is in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, I have discovered that my credit report was accessed by XXXX XXXX XXXX without my authorization, or any permissible purpose as defined under the FCRA XXXX According to the FCRA, a consumer report can only be furnished for specific permissible purposes, such as credit transactions, employment, insurance underwriting, or other legitimate business needs. I did not initiate any transactions, applications, or business relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX, nor did I provide written consent for my credit report to be accessed. By committing this act, you are also in violation of 18 U.S.C 1028A is a section of the United States Code that addresses aggravated identity theft because you have possession of my information and are using without my consent.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX and list of Inquiries. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> a payment was made to Synchrony bank the new servicer of my XXXX credit card. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email message ( attached ) that said the payment had been processed and no further action was required on my part. There was mention of an issue with the bank account number ( I was never asked to change or correct it ) but the payment was applied and the money no longer appeared in my account. It does say to log in to ensure it was processed which I have tried to do ( and am still trying! ) and no one at the company seems to know why I am unable to log in to my account other than as a Guest. The bank stated the money was not accepted by the servicer. I have asked them for this proof but it has not been provided. 

Then on XX/XX/XXXX I got an email stating my account was overdue and that the XX/XX/XXXX account had not been applied and was in delinquency. 

The change in card servicer was apparently XXXX but I never received a new card, a new statement and my payments were made prior thru Autopay and in that short window I did not check to see that it had not gone through. 

Upon calling the company, it was discovered that when the change between the two banks were made they did not have the correct contact information, clearly a clerical issue in their database. 

Attempts to make payments were made multiple times in XXXX in the 30 day window but the servicer could not process them and I am being held accountable for this.

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against TransUnion for reporting inaccurate, incomplete, and unverifiable information on my credit report, specifically related to the account Account number starting in [ XXXX ]. This reporting is a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA, GLBA, PRIVACY ACT OF 1974, TILA & ECOA.

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. TransUnion has failed to comply with this requirement. Specifically : Inaccurate Open Dates : The open date for this account is incorrect.

Inaccurate High Credit Limit : The high credit limit associated with this account is inaccurately reported.

Unverifiable Information : The information provided is incomplete and can not be verified.

These inaccuracies are damaging my creditworthiness and financial standing.

Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1666B Timing of Payment : This account is also reporting inaccurate late payments, violating my rights under 15 USC 1681a 15 USC 1681S-2, 15 USC 1681 2 ( A ) ( I ) & 15 U.S.C. 1666B.

According to 15USC 1681s-2 ( a ) Duty of furnishers of information to provide accurate information ( 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 USC 1666B A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

My account is set up to receive all notifications and statements by mail. However, the creditor did not follow the law, as they failed to mail or deliver any notice within 21 days before the payment due date. Without proper notice, a payment can not be legally treated as late, and the reporting of late payments is therefore both inaccurate and unlawful.

15 USC 1681 2 ( A ) ( I ) Talks about Transactions & Experiences between the consumer & the person, which persons means any individual, partnership, corporation, trust, estate, cooperative, association, government or governmental subdivision or agency, or other entity, is NOT included in the consumer report it is in the Exclusion Section. This must be removed immediately because if NOT this would fall under 15 USC 1681N Civil liability for willful noncompliance.

There are also more inaccurate information that is being reported with this account as well, the account mention is also being reported as an inaccurate charge off on my credit profile that is extremely miss leading. TransUnion is furnishing inaccurate information, The erroneous charge-off is adversely affecting my credit score and, consequently, my financial health. Misreporting of Income : A charge-off is considered as income, and it is improper to report such income on a credit profile. To date, I have not received a 1099-C form related to this charge-off, which further underscores the inaccuracy of this report. Income can not be legally reported on a credit profile, and this misreporting is misleading and damaging. Lack of Permissible Purpose : Under 15 USC 1681b, consumer reporting agencies must have a permissible purpose to furnish a consumer report. According to subsection ( 2 ), this can only be done in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

According to 15 USC 6801 states It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information.

Also 15 USC 6802b - 6805 shows I have the right to opt out. 16 CFR 313.7f states how I have the right to opt out at anytime.

These laws are put in place for me as a federal protected consumer & I have the right to speak on the inaccurate information that is being furnished on my credit report, I have the right to a fair & accurate consumer report under 15 USC 1681 & TransUnion is not doing that. I am requesting for action given these clear violations I respectfully request the CFPB not only investigate the inaccuracies and violation committed by TransUnion & Ensure that TransUnion corrects or removes the inaccurate, incomplete, and unverifiable information from my credit report. Address the improper reporting of late payments, as this is a direct violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1666B. These inaccuracies are unjustly affecting my credit profile and financial stability. I urge the CFPB to take swift action to rectify this situation.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was paid
Consumer complaint narrative:
Citizens Bank is in violation of multiple laws set forth by Congress in regards to the following account # XXXX. 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the person ( CITIZENS BANK ) making the report. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that A person ( CITIZENS BANK ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( ME ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. CITIZENS BANK can not collect on a discharged debt. This is now considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes reporting of this account inaccurate! By Definition, the IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is inaccurate. I never received a 1099-C from CITIZENS BANK for the cancelled debt of { {$52000.00} } } in order to file as ordinary income. Where is my 1099-C CITIZENS BANK is clearly writing off debt with the IRS without sending out 1099-C as required by the IRS for debts greater than { { {$600.00} } }. This is unsatisfactory! CITIZENS BANK has been HEREBY PUT ON NOTICE that they are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. In CITIZENS BANK terms and conditions they agreed not to share my information with non affiliates. XXXX, XXXX, XXXX is not an affiliate of CITIZENS BANK nor are they " bureaus ''. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and non verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant 15 U.S. Code section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION XXXX ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. CITIZENS BANK must also refund the remaining balance of the consumer account upon its termination. This is your 7 day notice to return ALL money due from this consumer account. 1026.11 Treatment of credit balances ; account termination. ( a ) Credit balances. When a credit balance in excess of { { {$1.00} } } is created on a credit account ( through transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, through rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or through amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of the consumer ), the creditor shall : ( 1 ) Credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumer 's account ; ( 2 ) Refund any part of the remaining credit balance within seven business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer ; ( 3 ) Make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order, or credit to a deposit account of the consumer, any part of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months. No further action is required if the consumer 's current location is not known to the creditor and can not be traced through the consumer 's last known address or telephone number. ( b ) Account termination. ( 1 ) A creditor shall not terminate an account prior to its expiration date solely because the consumer does not incur a finance charge. ( 2 ) Nothing in paragraph ( b ) ( 1 ) of this section prohibits a creditor from terminating an account that is inactive for three or more consecutive months. An account is inactive for purposes of this paragraph if no credit has been extended ( such as by purchase, cash advance or balance transfer ) and if the account has no outstanding balance. ( c ) Timely settlement of estate debts ( 1 ) General rule. ( i ) Reasonable policies and procedures required. For credit card accounts under an open-end ( not home-secured ) consumer credit plan, card issuers must adopt reasonable written policies and procedures designed to ensure that an administrator of an estate of a deceased accountholder can determine the amount of and pay any balance on the account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Application to joint accounts. Paragraph ( c ) of this section does not apply to the account of a deceased consumer if a joint accountholder remains on the account. ( 2 ) Timely statement of balance ( i ) Requirement. Upon request by the administrator of an estate, a card issuer must provide the administrator with the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Safe harbor. For purposes of paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) ( i ) of this section, providing the amount of the balance on the account within 30 days of receiving the request is deemed to be timely. ( 3 ) Limitations after receipt of request from administrator ( i ) Limitation on fees and increases in annual percentage rates. After receiving a request from the administrator of an estate for the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account, a card issuer must not impose any fees on the account ( such as a late fee, annual fee, or over-the-limit fee ) or increase any annual percentage rate, except as provided by 1026.55 ( b ) ( 2 ). ( ii ) Limitation on trailing or residual interest. A card issuer must waive or rebate any additional finance charge due to a periodic interest rate if payment in full of the balance disclosed pursuant to paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section is received within 30 days after disclosure. 
In addition, I have included the Paid in Full Letter from XXXX that should have closed this account in XX/XX/XXXX. Regardless you are in the wrong now and on notice.

Consumer complaint narrative: I saw an unrecognized charge on my credit card in XXXX and called to dispute it. I have been dealing with serious identity theft issues and my bank has allowed whomever to open up credit cards and link them to my account as well as allowed fraudulent charges although mine decline. They told my that there was another charge for the same thing in XXXX of XXXX. I was not aware and when they asked how I let them know XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  for my father who had been very ill these couple of years so I missed it! They started a dispute and let me know I would only be credited for XXXX. Meanwhile, I have been paying down my credit cards and trying to minimize the damage done by these identity theft thieves. So I get a call last week and they tell me that they credited north and have to take it back. What? I couldnt even see that they credited it but I can define see that they put it back in my card. Why would they give me a credit they said they wouldnt and continue to mess with my accounts. I asked for accountability by contacting corporate. They also locked my card and I could not access my money for a couple of days and no one can tell me why. They state its fraud protection but Im the only one declining. The thieves just made a purchase on Monday which is why I had to have my card shut down and replaced. They told me I could use my digital card and it declined. Spoke to someone for over 2 hours starting at XXXX on I believe Thursday and they said it was good to go. It also declined on Wednesday at a different store. Went to use it and it declined again. Had to wait until a branch opened at XXXX and speak with someone who had to do what I did but could look at my account in the computer and also see that they hadnt done what they said they were doing. The person at the branch was XXXX XXXX and he got it taken care of and gave me his number because this was a crazy, unprofessional and negligent situation Chase kept putting me in. Made no sense. This also caused a ripple affect because I was supposed to have XXXX but could not because I had to take care of my banking situation and go into places I would not have the day before XXXX. I got sick and had to reschedule so I am not happy! I have lost money, time and trust. I have been belong with Chase for almost 20 years. This is insane. Please pull the calls. There are so many including the call about the dispute where he stated they would not give more than the credit for XX/XX/XXXX. And listen to their reasoning for doing it. Conversations should be in XXXX and XXXX of this week and last week. They person that called me to take back the funds was XXXX even though I explained everything to her and could not see the transaction. And when I asked why they did it. They said they wanted to start the claim accuracy was not priority. This is my money they are playing with. And I have spent hours on the phone with them throughout the week. They state this is protection. Please also pull XXXX and/or XXXX when they allowed someone complete access to my account while adding another credit card and they did not shut my stuff down. I specifically asked how much time and what else they could have done to my account. They did not know they said they would investigate and go from there. They didnt change my debit card or suggest switching accounts. They didnt put fraud alerts on my transactions. This year with chase has been Hell!! I believe the hey locked my card in retaliation yesterday because I complained and called corporate. No one could explain it not even the branch. My kids were late to school. Hours of my life gone. {$100.00} gone. At this point they know someone has been messing with my account and they have been sort of the process for months. I have uploaded call logs, included some names that I can recall as well as identity theft information and acknowledgment from Chase dated

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America recently removed the online option that allowed the consumer to direct an overpayment of their monthly mortgage payment toward their principal balance. According to Bank of America agents, in order to pay extra toward our mortgage principal balance we now must wait until the initial payment has cleared and then make a second payment otherwise it will be allocated automatically to the next month 's bill, therefore not reducing interest accrual. The delay they are causing means consumers will pay more in interest and we believe that many people will not bother to make the second payment meaning the bank makes more money and the consumer loses a valuable tool to pay less. Bank of America should not be allowed to circumvent the consumer 's right to prepay their mortgage most efficiently. We hope that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau can intervene on behalf of Bank of America consumers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
The account XXXX is reporting a balance of {$XXXX} to the credit bureaus and it was discharged in bankruptcy. According to the chapter bankruptcy law a bankruptcy discharge is granted by the bankruptcy court to release the debtor permanently from personal liability for certain specified types of debts. In other words, the debtor is no longer legally required to pay any debts that are discharged. The debtor will usually automatically receive a discharge, excepting there is litigation inv

olving objections to the discharge. The discharge prohibits the creditors from taking any form of collection action on discharged debts, including legal action and communications with the debtor. If a creditor attempts collection efforts on a discharged debt, the debtor can file a motion with the court, reporting the action and asking that the case be reopened to address the matter. A creditor can be sanctioned by the court for violating the discharge injunction.

I am requesting for Wellsfargo to put the balance at 0 because I am not liable for this debt.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
For months, I'd been in dispute with Synchrony Bank/JCPenney ( SB/JCP ). They stated that I owed them {$13.00}. I claimed that I had overpaid {$9.00}. For decades, my payments to SB/JCP were for premiums to XXXX XXXX XXXX , for two insurance policies. This incident dropped my FICO Score by XXXX points. 

After countless telephone calls, to both SB/JCP and XXXX XXXX , I sent a detailed letter to SB/JCP. They admitted their mistake. I received a check, for my overpayment, and my XXXX  Score was restored to XXXX. 

-HOWEVER- Because of my countless 'phone calls, a second dispute had been opened, A Customer Service Representative XXXX XXXX, told XXXX that my payment of {$32.00} was never received. SB/JCP sent me an undated letter, asking for further documentation. SB/JCP wants : 1. An unredacted bank statement. 
2. A clear legible copy of the store register receipt, displaying the payment. 

The resolved, initial dispute had my Checking Bank Statement, showing that SB/JCP had deposited the {$32.00} ; and I sent the screenshot, emailed to me by SB/JCP, stating that my {$32.00} was processed, on XXXX. 
1. My redacted Checking Statement was accepted for the initial, resolved dispute. 
2. I didn't purchase anything at a store. As I stated in the first paragraph, monthly payments were for two insurance premiums. 

-HOWEVER- On the Checking Bank Statement, I had redacted my Balances ; and the Descriptions of other payments. I don't feel that SB/JCP needs to know that I charged groceries, utilities, medications ... and what my checking balance is. It's irrelevant to the dispute. The payment and amount paid to SB/JCP is unredacted. This unredacted item was accepted on the initial dispute. 
When I asked both a Customer Service Rep and a Supervisor why they need the whole bank statement unredacted, I was told, " unredacted statements are the bank 's policy. '' Because SB/JCP knows the {$32.00} was paid, I feel that THIS SECOND DISPUTE IS BOTH UNNECESSARY AND THREATENING. I'm afraid that my XXXX  Score and my Credit Rating are again going to be affected.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, my mortgage with XXXX was sold to Shellpoint mortgage. ( This loan was originally made in XXXX. ) The terms of the loan were we put our paychecks into the account, and it weighed against the daily interest. When the mortgage payment was due, it was automatically withdrawn from this account to pay it. We also paid our insurance, utilities and other bills from this account. For whatever reason, in the transfer of the account, Shellpoint is treating this loan as a conventional loan and it showed us delinquent for not paying the mortgage bill? I began calling them daily from XX/XX/XXXX onward to no avail. In addition to the changing the terms of the contract, they do not show my XXXX paychecks into the account in XXXX. They simply " can not find them ''. To make matters worse, they froze the account because of the delinquency of the mortgage payment. The irony is the money I need to pay this account in in this same account ( minus my missing paychecks ). XXXX XXXX department has assured me the missing payments were cashed by Shellpoint. I have borrowed money to pay the mortgage payment and open the account but it has no money in it because my checks are missing. My auto withdraw bills from this account are going unpaid. My credit rating is holding while I borrow money from others to pay my bills. This is really frustrating, embarrassing and a little unnerving.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the following accounts, which have been inaccurately reported on my credit reports by Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX. These accounts are not mine, and their presence on my credit report constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX I would like to bring to your attention that these unauthorized accounts have violated my rights under the FCRA as follows : Right to Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ) : According to this section, I have the right to privacy regarding my personal credit information. The reporting of these unauthorized accounts on my credit report breaches this right, as I did not consent to their inclusion. Furnishing of Accounts Without My Written Instructions ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : The FCRA clearly states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. I have never provided any authorization or instruction for these accounts to be reported under my name. These violations have caused significant distress and potential harm to my financial standing. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure that the unauthorized accounts are removed from my credit reports. Additionally, I request that any necessary corrective action be taken against the responsible parties to prevent future violations of my rights. Enclosed with this letter are copies of my credit reports from Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX, highlighting the unauthorized accounts. I have also included any relevant correspondence that may assist in the investigation. Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I trust that the CFPB will take swift action to resolve this issue and uphold the protections guaranteed to me under the FCRA. Please feel free to contact me if you require any additional information or documentation. Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XX/XX/year> CAPITAL ONE XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, UT XXXX NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a copy of my ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) consumer report, and I noticed some late payments posted on my consumer report : CAPITAL ONE XXXX CAPITAL ONE XXXX Your company is in clear violation of the law. Pursuant 15 USC 1681a 2 ( A ) ( i ) - EXCLUSIONS- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term " consumer report '' does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions between the consumer ( XXXX XXXX ) and the person ( CAPITAL ONE ) Making the report is not INCLUDED on my Consumer report! 
A Late payment is a transactional history, My HISTORY with your company. CONGRESS clearly states that the reporting of Transactions or experiences between the CONSUMER and the PERSON making the report is not included on the consumer reports! 
YOU HAVE VIOLATED THE FCRA 15USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) by reporting this transaction or experience on my consumer report which CONGRESS clearly states IS NOT included on my CONSUMER REPORTS. 
You have 10 calendar days to update my Payment history and or delete all late payments from the below account/s. 

CAPITAL ONE XXXX CAPITAL ONE XXXX Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above Late Payments, will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character 2. Negligent Non Compliance 3. Civil Liability 4. Mental Anguish 5. Fair Credit reporting Act 15 USC 1681 violations for willful noncompliance. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] Best regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Every month, Bank of America has been furnishing incorrect, inaccurate, incomplete and unverifiable information to my consumer profile and I have made them aware of this for the past 7 months since XX/XX/XXXX. This is regarding the credit account # ending in XXXX that was charged off in XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a letters to the consumer reporting agencies requesting an investigation into the accuracy of this account which they then forwarded to Bank of America, who then had the LEGAL OBLIGATION to conduct the investigation. 

In the letter, I specified areas of inaccuracies that I had identified such as the payment history and account status. The FCRA ONLY ALLOWS up to 30 days for this initial investigation. I demanded that if the consumer reporting agencies were unable to verify the account as accurate and complete, then they should then delete this account from my profile. Also for Bank of America to cease from furnishing this account! 

The consumer reporting agencies responded back by updating the account information as verified by Bank of America. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, I sent the the consumer reporting agencies a method of verification letter in which I requested account level documents from the data furnisher ( Bank of America ) and further proof of their verification/validation method. I again asked for the consumer reporting agencies to delete the account if they were not able to verify the information within the 15 day window that is allowed by the FCRA for this second verification/reinvestigation period. The consumer reporting agencies did NOT respond back within the 15 days, which is a VIOLATION of the FCRA! Neither did Bank of America provide them any documents to verify their method of their investigation. 

So around XX/XX/XXXX, which was well over 90 days since my initial letter was sent, I sent a complaint via the CFPB requesting that the account be deleted because the CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES AND BANK OF AMERICA FAILED TO PROVIDE ME WITH THE METHOD OF VERIFICATION/VALIDATION WITHIN THE 15 DAY PERIOD ALLOWED BY THE FCRA! Around XXXX, XXXX, the account seemed to have been removed by the consumer reporting agencies which led to a significant FICO score increase. 

But then it was evident that the account was reinserted days later and updated as verified by the consumer reporting agencies. They responded in their online portal and stated that Bank of America had verified the information as accurate and complete. But HOW CAN THE ACCOUNT BE verified as accurate when the original date opened was XX/XX/XXXX but there is NO PAYMENT HISTORY REPORTING until XXXX XXXX XXXX? How is the payment history accurate when the last payment date is showing as XX/XX/XXXX as well as XX/XX/XXXX? How is the payment history accurate when every month, they keep updating my account as charged off, which is re-aging my profile, which is illegal. 

It is now XX/XX/XXXX and the BOA charge off with account # XXXX is still being reported to my consumer profile! And there is still inaccurate information being reported such as the payment history, account status and date of last payment! At this point, this is willful non-compliance and deliberate reporting of inaccurate information to my consumer profile which is yet another violation of my consumer rights which are protected under the FCRA! 

I DEMAND THAT BANK OF AMERICA STOP FURNISHING THIS ACCOUNT TO THE CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES BECAUSE THEY ALREADY FAILED TO PROVIDE THE REQUESTED METHOD OF VERIFICATION AND VALIDATION OF DEBT WITHIN THE TIMEFRAME ALLOWED BY THE FCRA SINCE XXXX AND XX/XX/XXXX! I ALSO WANT BANK OF AMERICA TO STOP FURNISHING THIS ACCOUNT TO MY PROFILE BECAUSE IT INDEED HAS BEEN PROVEN TO BE INCORRECT, INCOMPLETE, INACCURATE AND UNVERIFIABLE! I WANT THIS ACCOUNT PERMANENTLY DELETED FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS AND I WANT BANK OF AMERICA TO STOP FURNISHING THIS ACCOUNT! 

If this account is not promptly DELETED from my consumer profile, then for damages, I will invoke my rights as a consumer pursuant to 15 USC 1681n Civil Liability for WILLFUL Noncompliance. If this account is not promptly DELETED then I will seek compensation for EVERY violation that has been found under the FCRA!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

15 USC 1666B ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 USC 1637 Before opening any account under an open end consumer credit plan, the creditor shall disclose to the person to whom credit is to be extended each of the following items, to the extent applicable : ( 1 ) The conditions under which a finance charge may be imposed, including the time period ( if any ) within which any credit extended may be repaid without incurring a finance charge, except that the creditor may, at his election and without disclosure, impose no such finance charge if payment is received after the termination of such time period. If no such time period is provided, the creditor shall disclose such fact.

( 2 ) The method of determining the balance upon which a finance charge will be imposed. 
( 3 ) The method of determining the amount of the finance charge, including any minimum or fixed amount imposed as a finance charge.

( 4 ) Where one or more periodic rates may be used to compute the finance charge, each such rate, the range of balances to which it is applicable, and the corresponding nominal annual percentage rate determined by multiplying the periodic rate by the number of periods in a year.

( 5 ) Identification of other charges which may be imposed as part of the plan, and their method of computation, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau.

( 6 ) In cases where the credit is or will be secured, a statement that a security interest has been or will be taken in ( A ) the property purchased as part of the credit transaction, or ( B ) property not purchased as part of the credit transaction identified by item or type. 
( 7 ) A statement, in a form prescribed by regulations of the Bureau of the protection provided by sections 1666 and 1666i of this title to an obligor and the creditors responsibilities under sections 1666a and 1666i of this title. With respect to one billing cycle per calendar year, at intervals of not less than six months or more than eighteen months, the creditor shall transmit such statement to each obligor to whom the creditor is required to transmit a statement pursuant to subsection ( b ) for such billing cycle. 
( 8 ) In the case of any account under an open end consumer credit plan which provides for any extension of credit which is secured by the consumers principal dwelling, any information which ( A ) is required to be disclosed under section 1637a ( a ) of this title; and ( B ) the Bureau determines is not described in any other paragraph of this subsection.

( b ) Statement required with each billing cycle The creditor of any account under an open end consumer credit plan shall transmit to the obligor, for each billing cycle at the end of which there is an outstanding balance in that account or with respect to which a finance charge is imposed, a statement setting forth each of the following items to the extent applicable : ( 1 ) The outstanding balance in the account at the beginning of the statement period.

( 2 ) The amount and date of each extension of credit during the period, and a brief identification, on or accompanying the statement of each extension of credit in a form prescribed by the Bureau sufficient to enable the obligor either to identify the transaction or to relate it to copies of sales vouchers or similar instruments previously furnished, except that a creditors failure to disclose such information in accordance with this paragraph shall not be deemed a failure to comply with this part or this subchapter if ( A ) the creditor maintains procedures reasonably adapted to procure and provide such information, and ( B ) the creditor responds to and treats any inquiry for clarification or documentation as a billing error and an erroneously billed amount under section 1666 of this title. In lieu of complying with the requirements of the previous sentence, in the case of any transaction in which the creditor and seller are the same person, as defined by the Bureau, and such persons open end credit plan has fewer than XXXX accounts, the creditor may elect to provide only the amount and date of each extension of credit during the period and the sellers name and location where the transaction took place if ( A ) a brief identification of the transaction has been previously furnished, and ( B ) the creditor responds to and treats any inquiry for clarification or documentation as a billing error and an erroneously billed amount under section 1666 of this title.

( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/scrub> 2024, I used XXXX to deposit {$20.00} ( plus XXXX disclosed fee ) into the commissary accounts of people who were being held in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Each time, I used my CapitalOne credit card to make these deposits. 

Unbeknownst to me, each of these deposits incurred a {$10.00} cash advance fee. I have no idea why these deposits are considered cash advances or treated any differently from other forms of money transfers ( like XXXX and XXXX, which are also connected to my credit card ), online donations to charities/political causes/etc., or regular purchases. Cash advance seems like a totally arbitrary category that essentially just describes what credit cards dolay out the money for a good or service in advance of when I pay for it. I had no idea I was being charged these fees for these specific transactions. 

I called CapitalOne today and asked them to waive the fees, but they refused to do so. I also asked them ( supervisor XXXX ID XXXX ) how customers are supposed to ascertain whats considered a cash advance vs any other money transfer via credit card, and I was told that I could call the bank in advance of any such transaction to check if its a cash advance or not. This I cant describe it to you, but I know it when I see it response is the hallmark of a policy that is so untransparent that theres no way for me to know when it could be sprung on me. Furthermore, it feels particularly predatory for this fee to be imposed for donations to an incarcerated persons commissary account, since thats a whole industry that gouges poor people at every level.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened my BOA credit card in XXXX. I always paid my bill on time. After receiving a notice from XXXX XXXX that something had changed, I checked my credit report and discovered my BOA account had been closed. My credit score had also plummeted XXXX points. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with 2 representatives. The first representative was completely unapologetic and informed me that I had been sent 3 emails : one in XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. When I looked I found 2 emails in my spam folder. She said there was no one else I could speak with. 

That same day, I called a different number and spoke to a representative. She said there was no one else I could speak with but that she would send my complaint to someone and I would receive an email response withing 24 to 48 hours. 

In this digital age, it is totally unrealistic for a company to think that emails are sufficient when systems can tag those emails as spam. I receive credit card offers from BOA every week, but they couldn't take the time to notify me by mail that they were closing my account due to inactivity. My account was XXXX XXXX XXXX and the closing of that account reduced my credit history and caused my score to XXXX When I looked on my credit report at the reason my account was closed, my credit report said it was closed at my request. This reason they closed it as reported is a lie. Plain and simple. I NEVER requested they close it. 

This business practice is no longer being practiced by other credit card companies. I have received other letters over the years and those accounts were not closed because they effectively contacted me by mail. 

This is an unfair business practice that needs to be stopped. My credit report is now damaged and I have no recourse but to report my experience.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I discovered that WePay had frozen my business funds totaling XXXX without any prior notice or explanation. My agency, which exclusively serves XXXX clients, relies heavily on these funds to operate and meet financial obligations. 

Upon realizing the issue, I immediately attempted to contact WePay, only to discover that they do not have a phone number for customer support. All communication is restricted to the submission of tickets, making it nearly impossible to get timely assistance. Out of desperation, I visited my Chase bank branch, hoping for a resolution, but they were unable to help. They informed me that while WePay is associated with Chase, it operates separately, leaving me in a confusing and frustrating situation. This lack of coordination is baffling, especially given Chases heavy promotion of its small business services, which was a major reason I moved my operations to Chase in the first place. I specifically chose Chase because of its inbuilt invoicing system, which I now realize is managed by WePay, yet they have no direct way to assist me in accessing the funds that I need to operate my company. 

In compliance with their requests, I promptly provided the following : Last three months of bank statements Receipts for all my invoices Correspondence with my clients Despite countless tickets submissions, full cooperation and submission of all required documentation, both WePay and Chase have failed to provide any justification for the continued withholding of my funds. Moreover, they have not communicated any next steps or provided a timeline for resolution. 

This unexplained freezing of funds has had a devastating impact on my business, causing severe financial strain and preventing me from fulfilling my commitments to clients. Despite multiple visits to my Chase branch, I am told that all resolutions must be handled through WePay, leaving me with no clear path forward. 

As of now, my funds remain unjustly frozen without any explanation or resolution in sight, critically undermining my ability to operate my business and meet my financial responsibilities. 

This version emphasizes the severity of the situation and the impact on your business, making it clear that immediate action is needed.
